characters: IS FILLED WITH LOVING YOU. LA LA LA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glistening city buildings reflect onto the WINDOW of an upscale clothing boutique. In the window -- a MANNEQUIN i wearing -- the best of everything. A PRETTY TWENTY-SOMETH girl looks in at the display: dreaming of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Year after year, twenty-something women come to New York City in search of the two "L's": labels and love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four TWENTY-SOMETHING WOMEN walk away from us -- arms lin LAUGHING -- They make their way down the busy street -- shopping bags and designer purses swinging. The young women reveal: CARRIE BRADSHAW (41) and fabulous -- walking towards us. watches them as they pass, a SMILE grows on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago... I was one of them. She walks along, her shopping bag -- swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie on step ladder, barefoot. Her finger moves along a series of DESIGNER shoe boxes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having gotten the knack for labels early... I concentrated on my search for love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer night. Couples everywhere. Carrie walks along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out, a "knock-off" is not as easy to spot when comes to love... She passes a twenty-something girl and guy huddled very c together. Suddenly, the girl SLAPS HIM across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until it is. CARRIE reacts, and trots along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE and preppy perfect CHARLOTTE walk along, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why you need help to spot them... JUMP CUT TO: Carrie, Charlotte and MIRANDA walk along talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Lots of help. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie, Charlotte, Miranda and SAMANTHA walk along; LAUGHING -- their shopping bags and designer purse swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front of Carrie's building.   She is typing in her wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie at her desk - typing. CLOSE ON the computer screen Written on it: "Charlotte, Miranda and Samantha..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Year after year, my single girlfriends were my salvation. And, as it turns out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A colorful CHICK LIT book cover: "A Single Life Carrie Bradshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My meal ticket. CARRIE -- standing on her bed placing it next to her TWO other books: "Sex and The City" and "Menhattan" A framed photo of four girls (circa 1999) is also on the shelf. She picks it up -- Touches it sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still are those four single girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE in a sexy, summer dress, spots someone -- waves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though, technically... we're not. She hurries across the street to meet that SOMEONE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA (41) and BRADY (5) are filling an inflatable pool with water from a hose. As STEVE approaches with Popsicle they squirt him with the hose. He grabs them; laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us is married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte (40) and HARRY and their beautiful Asian daught LILY (3) go around. Lily giggles, they kvell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us... married, divorced and re-married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deck of fabulous Malibu beachouse. Samantha (49) sits near the pool wearing a white bikini and huge white sunglasses making deals on the phone as SMITH lays nearby a bathing suit -- reading a script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us... relocated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks over and into the arms of that SOMEONE -- it MR. BIG -- waiting for her in front of an apartment build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... one of us stayed exactly where she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. A good kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In love. A kiss worth waiting four years to see. They turn and start into the classic apartment building. doorman tips his hat and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Big walk through the beautiful lobby and over the elevator... holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a good feeling about this one, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always loved this block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding the perfect apartment in New York City is like finding the perfect partner. It can take years. They push the elevator button. Doors open. They step on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many does this make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is thirty-three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky thirty-three! They laugh a little as the doors close on the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door is opened up by CAROL (55) their real estate agent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst. I just left you a message. Carrie and Big look in. The apartment is dark, claustroph -- awful. A male BUILDING AGENT (40) stands here. The smi leave Carrie and Big's faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Big)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-four. Lucky thirty-four? Big looks over at her. She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Building Agent holds the elevator doors open for Carr Big and Carol as they get on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything else opens up let us know. We're very interested in this building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do have another apartment that's not even on the market yet. Care to take a look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than you were looking to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More. The Agent reaches over and presses the "PH" button on the control panel. Carrie and Big react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous pre-war penthouse apartment. Empty except for beautiful light. Old-world New York City style. Elevator doors open into the penthouse foyer. Carrie and Big step

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so this is where they keep the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I've died and gone to real estate heaven. Look at this place. She swirls around to Big -- very grand dame; with accent. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooo, I live here. Carrie starts giggling. Big looks over to the agents. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be the altitude. Big smiles. Carrie laughs as the Agent walks on. AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And across the rooftop terrace --- CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What --   Nirvana? AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife has quite a sense of humor. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cool/quick) They're not married. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's my boyfriend. AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. The agent and Carol start out across the terrace.   Big a Carrie follow lagging a little behind. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't I a little old to be introduced as your boyfriend? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point taken. From now on... you'll be my man friend. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a dog. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if the shoe fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look. He swats her ass, gently as they go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Big lead the way into the bedroom. Big windows high ceilings. Beautiful light as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is the master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hideous. Hate it. Hurts my eyes. Big laughs, Carrie walks around taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is this place even available?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you live here what is there to fight about? Carrie opens the closet door. It is very small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the master closet? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Small for a room this size. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Hmmm. Now, I understand the divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can build you a better closet. Carrie looks at him; aghast. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we afford this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie screams with joy and shock. He laughs, thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, Miranda and Charlotte walk down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I got it." Just like that. "I got it" -- like he was picking up the check for coffee or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the closet which Big says he can redo -- also he says the kitchen needs work but I don't know about that `cause I keep sweaters in my stove. Carrie and Charlotte laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he bought it -- and you're going to live there with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, together. That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he'll own it. So. You are keeping your own place, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Miranda, please, I haven't figured out all the details yet, but I'm a smart girl and I'm sure I'll figure out something I'm comfortable with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to make sure you're being smart here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you for it -- but for now can't you stop worrying for me and just go ahead and feel what I want you to feel. Jealous. Miranda smiles. Carrie puts her arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealous of me living in this gorgeous penthouse in Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'm jealous. You're in real estate heaven and I'm in Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York magazine said Brooklyn is the new Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever wrote that - lives in Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. Hey Hollywood! Samantha is standing out in front of Christies. She waves them -- as she finishes a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha Jones... Smith Jerrod's manager -- I'm in New York `till Monday. She hangs up; as they reach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabulous. Let's go in -- I am so excited!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lobby bustling with NEW YORK WOMEN. All types. Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte and Miranda make their way through th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a rare occasion that brought all types of women together. The socialites, the trendies the yuppies, the yentas. The girls gently move past by an elderly YENTA, who react

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the pushing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and the girls enter a room filled with dramaticall lit jewelry cases that display amazing jewelry. On the wa around the gallery are large photos of a BEAUTIFUL RAVEN HAIRED WOMAN (45). She is captured in candid poses "out a about" New York city at various social events wearing the jewelry on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair Elkenn was a waitress turned model turned actress turned billionaire's girlfriend who came home one night to find herself unceremoniously turned out on the street. Samantha, Carrie and Charlotte page through the catalogue they walk. Miranda types on her Blackberry. CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she was getting the ultimate break-up revenge. An embarrassing and very public auction of all the jewelry he had given her when they were happy. The girls stop. Floating in a case at their eye level is unique, "two finger" FLOWER RING made out of diamonds. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. My baby. CARRIE/BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's a beauty. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saw this in the catalogue I said to Smith: This flower ring is the essence of me. One of a kind, filled with fire... CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a little too much. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Come on. Let's go spend some of my hard-earned Hollywood money. They make their way to the auction room. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- what's coming up on Smith's series? Is he going to sleep with that new blonde neurosurgeon? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sleeps with every hot woman doctor in that hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever get weirded out by seeing Smith in bed with all those other women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think it's hot. Sometimes, when I'm alone, I masturbate right along with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And people say the golden age of television is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, it's fake sex. When they're doing it -- no one's actually turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda like Steve and I. Miranda laughs. Everyone looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. (Beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But come one-- it's been seven years. He does that, I do this... It's not like a new plot twist is going to turn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISTINGUISHED WOMAN AUCTIONEER is at a podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next item. The flower ring. Samantha sits up, ready. An electric buzz moves through t crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Schadenfreude is the word for feeling pleasure at someone else misfortune -- This was "jewelryfreude."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUCTIONEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start the bidding at ten thousand. Samantha raises her number. The Auctioneer nods. AUCTIONEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you madame. Do I hear fifteen? A WOMAN IN A BUSINESS SUIT (40) on a phone, raises her number. Samantha looks over at her. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the gloves are off. AUCTIONEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I hear twenty? Samantha raises her number. AUCTIONEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty. Do I hear twenty-five? The Woman raises her number. AUCTIONEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five. Thirty? Samantha raises her number. Carrie's eyes widen. AUCTIONEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five? The Woman is talking with someone on the phone. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's bidding for someone on the phone. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair. The Woman raises her hand. Charlotte gives her a look. AUCTIONEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five. Forty? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserve this. I work hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I hear forty? Samantha raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I hear forty fi-- The Woman quickly raises her hand. Auctioneer nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex with only one man for I don't know how long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I hear fifty thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat; loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty fucking thousand! A LAUGH ripples through the room. Samantha glares at the rival woman, almost daring her. Carrie looks afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-five? The Woman raises her hand. Samantha reacts disappointed. Auctioneer looks at Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty? Sixty to our colorful bidder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carrie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I draw the line at fifty. Samantha shakes her head no. Carrie rubs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, Samantha, Miranda and Charlotte are primping in f of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this auction would be more fun... but it's kinda sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BABY VOICED WOMAN (45) next to Charlotte overhears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it? They look over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was just sad for me `cause I know her. But it's really sad, huh? And it's funny cause they were so happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Till they weren't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? We all told her to get married -- but she didn't want to push him. He'd been married three other times. So, she let it ride and then she came home one night and he had locked her out. She didn't even have anywhere to live. After ten years. Such a shame. She was a smart girl till she fell in love. Carrie catches Miranda's eye in the mirror, looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big takes a bright red lobster out of a pot of hot water tongs. He places it next to another cooked lobster. He wa to the cooking island where Carrie sits; sipping wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures are ready. Just gonna sit there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sitting, I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Husk and think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks -- puts two ears of corn in front of her, then starts chopping tomatoes. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking I'm going to sell my apartment and put the money towards heaven on Fifth. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You love your place. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but -- BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're together ever night -- so I'm basically paying a mortgage on a glorified closet. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You write there. It's your office. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's plenty of room at the new place and -- besides.. I want to make us -- a life there. I want it to be ours. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is ours. I bought it for us. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's so amazing --but you bought it, so it's really your place. And -- if anything were to happen... BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be smart here. I mean, we're not married and I'd have no legal rights to... this home that I built... with you. Silence. He thinks. Chops. She husks. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want to get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was an option. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Bradshaw, what if it was an option? She hits him with a husk. He smiles. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, people are always assuming we are. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what happens when people assume. They make an ass out of who? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me. He smiles. She smiles. Chop. Chop. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, kid? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why -- Do you want to get married? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn't mind be married to you. Would you mind being married to me? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, if that's what you want. Is that what you want? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you. So. Okay. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Really? We're getting married. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting married. (Beat) Should we get you a diamond? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, don't get me a diamond. (Beat; then) Get me a really big closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. He puts out his hand. She takes it and they shake. BIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... You gotta do better on that corn. Look at all the stuff left on there. She looks down at her corn, he's right. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded; serious lunch crowd. Carrie sits across from Charlotte and Miranda. Miranda is in a work suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the other night, Big and I were talking about, you know, moving in together and our future... Charlotte's eyes are getting wider and wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And about what makes sense as we move forward. And, well... we decided to get married. Charlottes SCREAMS at the top of her lungs. Carrie and Miranda and the ENTIRE RESTAURANT REACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I'm deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's looking Charlotte looks around at the DISGRUNTLED FACES. She half stands and address the DINERS looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! I'm sorry... but my friend here, just got engaged and she's been going out with the man for ten years. The DINERS bursts into APPLAUSE. Carrie slumps in her cha pulls up her sweater collar, turns to Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is literally a ringing in my ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large PHOTO of Smith. Samantha walks past it and up a sleek, modern office building stairway. Her cell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha Jones--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Carrie walking through the upscale boutique talking on her pink Swarovski crystal-covered cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I made a little decision that I hope you'll be happy about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey... you finally got Botox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not get Botox

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Carrie -- you'll love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not call to talk about Botox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. Samantha reaches the top of the stairs. Blow-ups of Smith various magazine covers line the walls of the chic, small office space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Last week, after the auction, I started thinking about my options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, and... well, Big and I decided to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sounded more excited about the botox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, honey -- I am excited for you but -- you know me... I don't really believe in marriage.... Botox on the other hand -- That works every time. A RECEPTIONIST (23) hands her some messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I've got to go. The People magazine person is on hold. Smith's on the short list to be their "Sexiest Man Alive." We can catch up when I'm in town next week. Samantha hangs up. Carrie looks at her phone: dismissed a disappointed. She closes it and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie rounds a corner. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Samantha standing in her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I was in shock. I mean, it's you getting married. This is not some random person -- it's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I guess, I thought that after that big mess with Aidan -- you'd never want to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I put you in my "we're never getting married" file. Now, I've got to take you out of that file. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the extra paper work. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get my bill. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, it feels so different this time. No clichГ© romantic kneeling down on one knee. Just you know, two grown-ups -- making a decision about spending their lives together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one more thing... I want you to be maid of honor. How do you feel about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same way you feel about Botox. Painful and unnecessary. Carrie laughs. Samantha shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Charlotte sit on her bed looking through a lis names. ANTHONY sits at her makeup vanity. He has a large notebook open in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74, 75, 76.... Seventy-six guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy five sounds better. "A small, wedding of seventy five guests." Carrie looks at the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a wedding gift, Charlotte had given me Anthony Marantino -- friend and wedding planner. Carrie crosses someone off. Charlotte reacts, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She was borderline anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut throat -- I love it. I hope you're that decisive when it comes to the location and the dress. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I found the dress. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! When? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other day. I have it here. Carrie gets up and goes into the closet. Anthony hurries and sits next to Charlotte. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be good! CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited! CARRIE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is. Anthony and Charlotte grab hands in anticipation as Carri comes out of her closet. She holds up a simple OFF-WHITE VINTAGE SUIT. Charlotte and Anthony deflate. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that was the exact reaction I was aiming for. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's pretty but it's so -- simple. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple and classic. When I saw it I just thought: That is what I should marry Big in. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who's it by? The label? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. I found it in a vintage shop. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The bride wore a dress by no one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and heads back into the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As she goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll style it up with shoes. Anthony turns to Charlotte and says in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The invitation is fancier than the dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "family style" Italian restaurant. Miranda, in business clothes, sits with Steve, Brady and MAGDA. Brady's face i covered in spaghetti sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And from Anthony Marantino to spaghetti marinara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he with the check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geese, Miranda -- relax. Magda's not even finished yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have a legal brief to work on when I get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take him. Wash that beautiful face too, yes? Brady nods. Magda walks away with Brady. Miranda is packi up Brady's action figures. Steve gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm sorry. I'm exhausted. Brady woke me up at five AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He woke me up too. Silence. She sips her cappuccino. Foam covers her top lip looks over at her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got milk on your top lip. She licks it off, not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like you're always criticizing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not. (Beat; then, cute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go through life with foam on your lip and no one telling you? Silence. He reaches down and picks up her coffee cup and sips... putting lots of foam on his lip. He looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you want to tell me? She shakes her head: No. He puts his face in front of her She laughs. He licks his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is in bed with Miranda, they are making love. She i wearing a T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait --- wait -- Don't come already...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait -- get on top.    Get on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late... let's just get it over with. Steve looks at her. She can't believe what she's said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean -- We have to get up in four and half hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never have sex and you want to get it over with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve... We have sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time we had sex? Miranda can't remember. He moves to his side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As he turns away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was snow on the ground. He gets out of the bed and walks away. She watches him go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are having breakfast. Lily sits at the table in booster seat coloring in a Cinderella coloring book. Carr is helping her. CLOSE ON: Cinderella's shoe. Carrie is filling it in with a BLUE CRAYON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How often do you guys have sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda -- please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She indicates that Lily is sitting with Carrie. Carrie continues to color, not looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I know all about sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I knew the girl talk was going to be on "lock down," I wouldn't have flown two thousand miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we can talk, let's just not use that word. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's three, she doesn't know what it means. I'm forty- two and I still don't know what it means. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but she's repeating everything. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. How often do you guys... CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... "Color"? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't color enough. I would color all day -- every day if I had my way. I'd use every crayon in my box. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get it. You love to color. (To Miranda) Why are you asking? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and I were "coloring" last night and just as I was about to -- Miranda is searching for a word she can use. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come? (beat; to Charlotte) Sorry -- there is no crayon equivalent. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to change positions and I said... "Let's just get it over with." The ladies react, three different shades of shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he kept trying to make it last longer. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is when you have a full-time job. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a full-time job. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you don't also have a five year old and play groups and PTA and a mother-in-law in a rest home with advancing Alzheimer's. I'm telling you, at the end of the day all I want to do is sleep. The most exciting thing in bed now -- is the bed. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Sleep is the new sex? LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I meant coloring. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just going through a no coloring phase -- it comes and goes, right? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every couple is different. Harry and I -- Carrie and Samantha look over; interested. CHARLOTTE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Make love two or three times a week. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now I feel worse. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when was the last time for you? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my. Miranda looks at her. She -- continues to color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's a dry spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you and Big, Carrie? (Off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. But, I will tell you this. When Big colors -- (Beat; sexy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rarely stays inside the lines. Samantha whoops. Carrie resumes coloring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this was very helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freshly-showered Samantha sits on a chaise lounge in a -- talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it to Smith Jerrod at the office address. Smith walks up to Samantha wearing only underwear. There huge bulge in the front. Samantha takes the bulge in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. Something just came up. She hangs up. He smiles, looks down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a gift for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far, I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles as she reaches INTO his underwear basket and removes a long black velvet jewelry case. She opens it. I the petal ring from the auction. SAMANTHA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did -- Wait -- that was you on the phone at the auction? SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew how much you wanted it. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was going to buy it for myself. SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to give it to you... for our anniversary. We met five years ago today. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; had no idea) Right. He smiles, sits down on the bed. SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be clear -- This is a ring with diamonds -- not a diamond ring, right? (Off his nod) In that case... I love it. (Re; underwear) It's my second favorite thing I've ever found in there. She kisses him, touched -- then reaches in his underwear. SAMANTHA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, my gift's a little bit more... oral. SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe -- I've got to go to bed. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed? It's seven-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be at the studio by six A.M. and I need to get a workout before that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how it starts. Next thing you know... we're only having sex three or four times a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people consider that normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not most people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - you most certainly are not. He smiles, leans in and gives her a hot -- hot kiss. The leads -- to reaching into underwear... as they start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith is laying in bed. Sound asleep. The clock on the be table reads: 9:01.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. Samantha sits in the jacuzzi wearing her ring -- sipping a glass of wine -- bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One glass of Merlot and two orgasms later. Samantha hears MOANING. The sounds of someone having SEX the house right next door. She looks -- from the hot tub can see her neighbor DANTE -- hot, dark -- "sex on a stic in his living room making wild love to a RED HAIRED WOMAN They are naked. Samantha watches and sips -- not so bored

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is how Samantha learned she had a new neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters the apartment.   It is dark-ish. A candle o is lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John? The terrace doors are open. The curtains blow, gently. walks out onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she steps out onto the terrace. Big comes up behind he He -- leans her against the door jamb and kisses her. It' hot. He kisses her -- sliding down the front of her body.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BIG'S SUBLET/BEDROOM-- LATER
dialogues.text: Big is in bed wearing "half glasses," reading The Wall St Journal. Carrie enters from the bathroom and hops into be She grabs a LIBRARY BOOK from the night stand and looks o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lean? He nods and lifts up one of his arms. She slides over and nestles in, leaning up against him. She opens her book. H looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the last person in New York still taking out library books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the smell. She smells the book, then holds it up to him. He smells. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an old one. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Love Letters of Great Men." Volume one. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in there? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but some of your classmates are. Voltaire, Napoleon... Big smiles. She takes the glasses off his face and puts t on, looks at book. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get glasses. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't -- you have them. (then; off book) Here's Napoleon... (Reads) "My dearest Josephine, I wake consumed with thoughts of you --" BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical short guy. Gives it all away up front. She punches him a little, continues to read. BIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you reading this? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research for my new book. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it about? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love. I use to write about finding love-- now I want to write about what happens after you've found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. What happens? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay tuned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles. She looks at the book again. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... Here's Beethoven. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it, Ludwig. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading) "My thoughts go out to you today my immortal beloved. I can live only wholly with you or not at all." BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good stuff. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading) "Be calm my life, my all. Only by calm consideration of our existence can we achieve our purpose to live together. Oh continue to love me, never misjudge the most faithful heart of your beloved. Ever thine -- ever mine -- ever ours. Silence. The beautiful sentiment hangs in the air. She cl the book and looks up at him. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever written me a love letter? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a love fax count? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When have I ever gotten a love fax? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure my secretary sent one at some point. Carrie looks at him, mock disappointed. BIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say, baby? Not my style. (Beat) Besides, these guys had to write-- they were separated from their loves by wars and hundreds of miles. I'm right here. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. She smiles. He kisses her on the forehead. Sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.... Put it in writing. He laughs, she looks at her book, turns a page and reads. After a beat, he puts down his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Here's a love letter from me to you. She looks up at him, excited. He speaks romantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loving you. Is easy... `cause your beautiful... Big continues --   now SINGING the Minnie Ripperton class

dialogues.speaker: LA LA LA LA OOOOOOOOOOOOOOO.
dialogues.text: Carrie LAUGHS as he continues to massacre the high notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie runs past the stone lions and up the grand stairs holding three LIBRARY BOOKS in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands at the entrance while a FEMALE GUARD (60) checks the contents of her purse. A FLORAL DELIVERY MAN c in carrying a GORGEOUS ARRANGEMENT OF WHITE FLOWERS. He c to the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way's the wedding? The Guard points, bored. Carrie looks, interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful space. The tables are being set up as MORE FLOWERS arrive. Carrie tip-toes in and looks around. A SM grows on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Big sit at the bar -- having dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we get married at The New York Public Library? (Gushy and silly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think how perfect. You and I and our love story surrounded by all the other lesser love stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to make that big of a deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that big a deal. It's seventy-five people in a room that's partitioned in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just -- I've already had two big weddings. Carrie winces -- stung. After a beat, she goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- a judge, couple friends and then we go for ham and eggs after. A bucket of cold water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. Big looks over at her. She looks upset, hurt, sad. Silenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would we have to whisper? In the library?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks over at him, softens a little. BIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Do you, Carrie" -- Shhhh. "Take this man" -- SHHHH! He raises his eyebrow. She laughs. ELAINE (40) Zaftig, Je -- spots Carrie. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, hi! CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, hi. Do you know John? ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hi. Nice to meet you. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine writes a single gal column for The New York Post. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- I'd rather you reveal my weight. Carrie and Big laugh. ELAINE (CONT'D)V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's new? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. We're getting married. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep -- At the New York Public Library. Carrie looks at Big, touched. Elaine is delighted, TEARFU ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! This gives me such hope. She hugs Carrie, then hugs Big. Then hugs Big again. ELAINE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you. Thank-you for marrying someone our age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, Harry and Lily are having breakfast. A KING CHARLES SPANIEL and TWO MUTTS sit on the floor looking up them. Charlotte pages through the New York Post -- She notices something. CLOSE ON: NEWSPAPER; A small PHOTO: of Carrie on "PAGE SIX" above a mention of the wedding. Charlotte SCREAMS. Harry and Lily JUMP. She grabs the cordless phone from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Carrie on the phone as Big sips coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The ultimate single gal Carrie Bradshaw will be married in Manolos to New York financier John James Preston come fall."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Big)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our wedding's on Page Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would put that in there? Carrie shrugs, Charlotte continues reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Proving to single gals everywhere that there can be a happy ending over forty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is walking down the street with STANFORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that day, I met my friend Stanford for our weekly quick lunch and gossip session... Also known as "dish then dash."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to a certain trashy tome, you are marrying John James Preston. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumor has it. STANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one question: Does Big know? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs; then) Where are we eating? STANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere you like... and you know the rule -- the person on Page Six pays for lunch. Carrie laughs. TWO WOMEN spot her and scream.   She and Stanford REACT as the women GUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Stanford are mid-meal. Three GAY MALE friends 40) stand at their table and gush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seemed everywhere I went... people I knew were excited and available to come to the wedding. A WAITRESS (23) places a check on the table.    Stanford at it, then leans in to waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to charge us for the gaggle of gays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Stanford are walking by a nail salon as BITSY MUFFLING, socialite, comes running out -- Mid-pedicure. S is barefoot with foam pads stuck between her painted toes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie Bradshaw Preston! Carrie Bradshaw Preston! Carrie and Stanford stop -- turn around.    Bitsy gushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazel tov! Saw you on Page Six! September? October? When? (beat; realizes feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Will you look! I got so excited -- no shoes. I'm standing barefoot on a New York sidewalk probably getting trichinoses. She hurries away, turning back to CALL as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the same address -- different floor. Just send it -- they'll get us the invite. She waves, goes back inside.   Carrie looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shocking thing was not the plethora of empty autumn social calenders but knowledge that everyone does indeed read Page Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the glass door and walks into the Vogue offi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even people you didn't expect, like my Vogue editor, Enid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is with ENID (60) her stunning, icy Vogue editor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're putting together our annual "Age" issue -- and we'd like you to do forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Who am I interviewing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You. You are forty. I want you to be featured in the magazine as the forty year old -- and here's the brilliant twist -- bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- I would be in the magazine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In bridal couture. It's a once in a lifetime opportunity - so spare me a week of faux soul-searching and just say yes. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid -- I'm so very flattered but-- ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie. Vogue designers, Vogue photographers, Vogue airbrushing. (Beat) Nod your head: yes. Carrie smiles and nods. ENID (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you. It will be a sensation. We're calling it: "The Last Single Girl." CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm hardly the last single girl. ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but forty is the last age you can see a woman photographed in a wedding gown without the unintended Diane Arbus subtext. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the issue was "great style at every age." ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Style yes... bride no. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles; then) Enid -- I have no idea -- were you ever married? ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Briefly. In 1975. I wore Halston. Creme. One shoulder Grecian with a low-cut bodice to the waistline for a dramatic flair. The fabric in the sleeves formed oval draping on the sides. Stunning. My future husband and I saw it on a trip to Paris and he fell in love with it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENID (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insisted I be married in it. So I was. We had quite a beautiful party. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles; then delicately) Why didn't the marriage work out? ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you not hear me say my husband fell in love with my gown? (beat; off Carrie's nod) Has your fiancГ©e expressed any interest in what you'll be wearing? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None at all. ENID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you may have a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands on the set of a Vogue photo shoot wearing a GORGEOUS VERA WANG GOWN. Hair, make-up: stunning. She is surrounded by VOGUE STYLISTS and CREW. Carrie looks over Samantha, Stanford and Charlotte standing on the side-lin watching. They signal their approval. Carrie smiles... tentative -- but excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking quite at home for someone who didn't think she had the bride gene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess with the right man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And the right dress. Charlotte and Samantha smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get married, I'm wearing something like that. But bigger. Samantha and Charlotte laugh. The PHOTOGRAPHER starts working. FLASH! Carrie poses. FLASH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just your typical Wednesday. Breakfast with... Vera Wang. FLASH!   Carrie in another GORGEOUS WEDDING wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid-morning coffee with.... Carolina Herrera. FLASH!   Carrie in another FAMOUS DESIGNER wedding gown. Samantha holds up her iPhone and takes a photograph of Carrie. Charlotte looks at it, smiles, then presses -- "send."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is at her desk, working -- her phone -- "beeps." picks it up -- CLOSE ON: PHONE announcing a photo arrival She opens the photo - it's Carrie in the wedding dress. Miranda smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! Carrie in another FAMOUS DESIGNER wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appetizers with Oscar de la Renta. FLASH: JUMP CUT TO: Carrie in another FAMOUS DESIGNER wed gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch with Lanvin... FLASH: JUMP CUT TO: Carrie in another FAMOUS DESIGNER wed gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And Lacroix. FLASH: JUMP CUT TO: Carrie in another FAMOUS DESIGNER wed gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And Dior. FLASH: Carrie in the final FAMOUS DESIGNER wedding gown. is the most sensational topper. She looks "beyond, beyond beautiful in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for dessert -- Vivienne Westwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte and Stanford are looking at Carrie, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confection so special...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha reaches up and wipes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It could wring a wedding tear from even the most unbelieving of women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door to find a DELIVERY MAN standing the with a very large dress box tied by a lush RIBBON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the impossible happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT TO: Carrie pulling back the tissue paper to reve her favorite wedding gown. Carrie picks up a hand-written note on an engraved note card from VIVIENNE WESTWOOD. It reads: "I saw the photos from the shoot. This dress belon to you. Cheers!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie peeks around the closet and looks in. The gown is hanging next to the white suit, dwarfing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just like that, Vivienne Westwood kicked my sweet little suit's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big leads Carrie into their new bedroom by the hand. Her are closed and she has a DESIGNER shopping bag slung over one arm. He moves her around the construction debris, stopping in front of the new closet's double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Open them. Carrie opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double door. So far so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the closet doors, revealing a beautiful oversiz walk-in closet with shelves and more shelves and places f shoes and more shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You did me proud, Mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it? It's love at first sight. He smiles, proud. She takes the DESIGNER shoe box out of shopping bag and hands it to him. She opens the lid, take out a pair of COLORFUL/FUN HEELS and places them on the shelf. She turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I believe this is all really happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, Charlotte and Carrie are standing in Carrie's apartment. Empty boxes are everywhere. Lily is coloring quietly nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it sold so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a sign I priced it too low. The door buzzes. Carrie pushes the intercom button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the food -- money on the table. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get started in the closet... I should be done in seventeen years. Carrie starts into the bathroom. Charlotte calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink Post-it -- take. Purple -- toss. Yellow: Storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good friends. There is a knock on the door. Miranda opens it. Samantha stands there with her carry-on luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha! Oh my God! Carrie re-enters from the bathroom... stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lot of shit went down in this place. Attention must be payed! She reaches into her bag and pulls out a bottle of champa They all CHEER. She reaches in again and pulls out anothe bottle. More cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is packing Carrie's collection of CD's, tapes an albums. She puts on a "Best of the 80's" CD. MUSIC START: Run DMC & Aerosmith: "WALK THIS WAY." Carrie comes   out of her closet wearing an outfit that s "80's." Lily   looks up from her coloring. Miranda, Charl and Samantha   sit on the bed drinking champagne. Carrie They hold up   hand-written signs: "Take" or "Toss." JUMP CUT TO: Carrie comes out of the closet wearing anoth "80's" outfit. The girls vote: "Take, Take, Toss." Carrie nods. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie comes out of the closet wearing a tig pink top and a tutu. The girls LAUGH; then all hold up: "Toss." Carrie reacts. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie comes out wearing a late "90's" outfi The girls vote: "Take, Take, Take." Carrie is thrilled - keeps it. JUMP CUT TO: Miranda wearing something from Carrie's clos JUMP CUT TO: Charlotte wearing something from Carrie's closet. JUMP CUT TO: Samantha wearing something from Carrie's clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT TO: Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte and Samantha LAUG -- at something. REVEAL: Lily standing in the closet, nak except for her training underpants. Her arms are outstret and draped with Carrie's small purses and bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls in the apartment are surrounded by many, boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took four friends, three days to put twenty years into twenty-eight boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks through her now, empty apartment. She takes last long look and leaves. END MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve sits in a chair as Miranda hands a cup of tea to hi mother MARY. She looks up at Miranda, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know me -- I'm your daughter-in-law. (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Miranda nods and smiles. Steve watches, touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is putting away groceries. Steve is sitting at th kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I run over to see your mother tomorrow maybe you can take him to the first birthday party alone. Then -- I'll meet you at the twins' party and you can leave and be at the bar by six. She looks over at him. He looks strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Steve. He starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I had sex with someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda can't believe her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And you are so amazing with Ma and everything... everything you do and I can't believe I would do that to you. Miranda just sits -- looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I hadn't had sex in a really long time and I -- Miranda shakes her head, turns and walks out of the kitch He gets up and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't mean anything -- It was just once... and it's been killing me. She stops and turns around. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's killing you?! She starts down the hall again. He's on her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just happened... I wasn't thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not follow me. She starts up the stairs. He stops at the bottom and watc her go. Lost as to what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door. Miranda stands there with Brady. S looks like she is about to burst into tears. Big stands i the hall behind Carrie. Unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise -- Here we are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Brady)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm so excited you are here for a sleepover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are too. Aren't we B-boy? Brady nods. Miranda gives Brady's hand to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Mommy has to go to the bathroom. Miranda hurries away. Carrie looks after her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady, do you want to go have some peanut butter? He nods. Carrie give his hand to Big and hurries away. Bi looks at Brady. Brady looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peanut butter it is. They walk into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is sitting on the toilet, seat down. Carrie at th sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently you don't have sex for six months he runs out and has it with some girl at his bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve. I can't believe it. Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve. When I think of everything I've done for him. And this is how he repays me. Man, if I didn't have Brady, I would never go back there. Miranda looks furious. Carrie nods, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is in bed. Miranda comes in, dressed for bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next night, for the sake of Brady, Miranda went against her instincts and went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws back the covers. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, it's still me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there and looks at him. Shakes her head, exits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda walks into the chic hotel lobby holding Brady's h She pulls a piece of luggage behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Miranda left Brooklyn and came home... to Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady sits   on a couch in the lobby playing with his act figures. A   HOODED MOVIE ACTOR TYPE (25) sits slumped ne texting on   a phone. Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte and Sama are having   brunch at a table nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's sad, but I'm not going to make it any sadder by staying at a bad hotel while I look for a place. Pass the salt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte passes the salt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, I have to be downtown and close to Brooklyn. We're going to keep things as normal for Brady as we can. I'll pick him up on my days... take him over on Steve's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if this question is allowed -- but how is Steve handling this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says he's devastated -- begs me to forgive him. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not going to happen. I can barely even look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve -- I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, honey -- are you sure you want to do this? It's just one time. Anyone can have a slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, even if I could get my head around that justification -- it's the cheating part -- the behind my back part... the violation of the trust -- that's the thing that's killing me. Samantha nods, taking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides... women who stay with men who cheat are women who are afraid to be on their own. And that's not me -- I can handle it. Always could. Brady walks over holding an action figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, I want to go home. Miranda nods; keeping a brave face. Charlotte looks upset

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte and Harry are making love, gently. She looks in his eyes -- speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you for being you. He smiles, touched. She smiles -- he kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte made love to Harry five times that week. 61aA   INT. SAMANTHA'S BEACH HOUSE -- NIGHT -- FALL Smith and Samantha are sitting at the dining table. ANAKA (45) a Zen, low-key chef lays down plates in front of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little quick to move out, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her reaction is her reaction. Thanks Anaka. Anaka nods and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had sex once. Not even an affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not the sex. Maybe, it's the cheating. For me... that would be the thing. That it happened behind my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she said. He nods. Samantha eats. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I know we're not married but - - if you were going to have sex with someone else... Long pause. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you waiting for me to get out my datebook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... seriously, I'd rather know first. She gets up from the table and moves over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to tell you if I'm going to have sex? Fine. I'm about to have sex. She sits on the table directly in front of him and opens legs. Anaka enters -- sees her position, spins on his hee and walks back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Anaka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary sits in a chair eating dinner from a tray. Miranda s on the edge of the bed near her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if Steve's mentioned anything to you yet -- about us. Has he? Mary shakes her head: No -- concerned. Miranda nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- we've had some marriage problems -- it's not necessary to go into the details but -- I just wanted you to know that we won't be coming to see you together anymore. I'll be here Monday, Wednesday and Sunday -- the other days will be Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda was starting to see the upside of Alzheimer's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is crowded with Carrie's boxes waiting to be mov Big is sitting at a computer reading his emails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on screen: We see his email address is John@JJPny.c He clicks open a file as Carrie enters. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedding crunch time. We need to really get serious here. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now -- I just got an email from the the contractor -- they pushed our move-in date again -- and I have to -- CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Wedding before contractor. Unless you're planning to invite him -- which would make the guest list two hundred and one. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred? Jesus, Carrie -- it's gone up again? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blame the New York Post and Vogue. Two publications that have never before been uttered in the same sentence. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said: seventy-five people in a partitioned-off room. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the dress. How can I explain this? It's like poker -- The dress upped the ante. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change the dress. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no -- you haven't seen this dress. This dress may be the whole reason to get married. Well, you and the dress. She sits in his lap. He adjusts, uncomfortable. CARRIE(CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you coming with your vows? Just a reminder -- you are going to be saying these in front of a lot of people, so the pressure is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (He's had it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up, up. I have to finish this. Up. He sort of "helps her" out of his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our wedding and you're not taking it seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not -- It's a circus! Two hundred people -- Page Six -- This is my third marriage -- how do you think it makes me look? Carrie looks at him, stunned by this new information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know that was even an issue. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say anything sooner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- don't you want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you, Carrie. That's what I want. I would have just gone down to city hall. Tension. He starts out of the room, moving a wardrobe box of his way as he goes. She stands there. Upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big is brushing his teeth. There's a knock. The door open Carrie comes in, vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's too late for city hall now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. I wasn't suggesting -- I was just saying. He looks at her. She looks -- devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. That is the face I've been trying to avoid. Come here. She stands there. He goes to her, hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great man friend. She buries her head in his chest; relieved. He exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, Charlotte, Harry, Samantha, Smith, Stanford, Anthony, Bitsy and other GUESTS are gathered around a lon beautifully-set table. Carrie and Big ARRIVE at the top o the stairs. Everyone looks up and applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desserts are being served. Samantha stands and prepar to speak. Harry hits a glass with a spoon... people quiet down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I know it's tradition at the rehearsal dinner for the maid of honor to reveal embarrassing things about the bride. But in our group -- She looks at Carrie, Charlotte and Miranda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We never kiss and tell. Carrie, Miranda and Charlotte WHOOP. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'd like to make a toast to the groom. From somewhere down the table, KARL (50) a Preppy Busines CALLS OUT; joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a word he's heard before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room LAUGHS. Big smiles; tight. Carrie leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl... a partner at the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl's kind of a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say -- three times a charm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling to Karl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey "dick wad"... I'm speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. There were times when we had our doubt about this gorgeous man. But after careful observation over the last hundred years, my doubts are over. (Lifts glass high)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... here's to the groom. A man who finally got "Carrie-d" away. Big is touched. Then Karl feels the need to add:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's hopin', John! Big smiles, he has no choice. He raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is out front with Big, Harry and Smith. They are smoking cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a toast, Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're quite a guy. They chuckle, then -- Samantha's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve. The men turn as Steve approaches. He has a look of real p and guilt and embarrassment on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to bother you all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not bothering us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --- I need to talk to Miranda. Samantha, could you -- ask her to come out. I don't want to go in. It's a party and all. Samantha is trapped... trapped and touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda comes out of the ladies room. Samantha spots her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I haven't talked to you all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve's here. The blood drains from Miranda's face. Samantha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is standing with Smith, Big and Harry as Miranda co out of the restaurant -- Samantha looks out from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you give us -- The guys go inside. Samantha gives Miranda a look and lea them away. Miranda turns. She glares at Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't leave me any choice. You won't return my calls -- You only talk to me in front of the baby when you know I can't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could you possibly have to say that could make it better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, please... It was just that one time. Please -- I love you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke us! You broke us. What we had is broken! Three YOUNG SINGLE GIRLS (25) walk past them into the clu They look back at the scene. Miranda looks down at the ground. Steve is paralyzed. Miranda turns to leave -- loo back at him with daggers and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed who I was for you. Miranda goes inside. Steve is a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda makes her way through the crowded bar. She looks rattled. Big spots her and follows, gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not alright. You two are crazy to get married. Marriage ruins everything. Miranda walks away, upset. He stands there; shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
