dialogues.text: Big is at the bar having a scotch. Carrie hurries over to him. She leans in and puts her arm on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. I thought you skipped out on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, kisses him. He smiles, sips his scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the all-gal sleepover is about to commence. You gonna miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. Spend the night with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... One night won't kill you. And tomorrow you get to have me for the rest of your life. He sips his scotch. She looks at him, sees a glimmer of something. Something that scares her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay? He looks over -- sees her face. Scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tired -- I guess. Carrie reaches up and fixes Big's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home and sleep. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, give me a kiss good night. Make it good -- it's the last single girl kiss. He looks at her as if to say something, then kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits on the bed surrounded by Charlotte, Samantha, Miranda all wearing matching robes. Laying on the floor n the bed -- three open gift boxes and ribbons. Lily sits i Carrie's lap playing with Carrie's cell phone -- in her P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we sat... like a scene out of Louisa May Alcott's: "Not-so Little Women."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew she would marry Big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA/MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not! CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did! After every break-up I secretly thought: Nope. They belong together. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought that after the second break-up? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the fifteenth? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha -- hilarious -- we broke up a lot. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but... after the break-ups -- comes the hot make-up sex. Charlotte pokes Samantha; indicates Lily. Samantha rolls eyes. Carrie's cell phone RINGS. Lily wants to answer it. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to answer? Go ahead, sweetie... Open it up... Lily opens it and holds it up to her face, silent. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something. LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex. They are all shocked; then: LAUGHTER, even Charlotte. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, that was your first bootie call. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure she's not my child? Carrie, still laughing, wipes a tear away as she takes th phone from Lily and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big is sitting at the desk, a piece of paper on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God -- did you just hear Lily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I need to talk. Carrie puts her hand to her ear, blocking the laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sitting here trying to write these vows and... (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this something we really want to do? Carrie gets out of bed; playing it "casual" to the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Big. I'm gonna take it in the-- She points to the study. Charlotte calls to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling; silly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep, groomie! Carrie goes into the study and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie leans against the door, her face now concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just -- everything is great as it is. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to screw it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I screwed it up twice before. Big is silent. Carrie is thinking, thinking, thinking. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the thing. This is me that you're marrying tomorrow. Me. Nobody else. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm marrying you. It's me and you. And you want to know the good news there? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already both done everything we can to screw it up. He smiles. She is very alert -- thinking, thinking. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a smile I'm hearing? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, it sounds to me like you've got a bit of writer's block on the vow front. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I find - you know - as a professional writer- it's best to just, you know, stop thinking about it so much -- and go to bed. And in the morning... BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And if not -- Just write this: "I will love you." Simple and to-the-point. And I swear I won't even try to take credit for it. Silence. Deep silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to bed now, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow. Hey. Me and you. He hangs up. She looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Charlotte and Carrie are sharing the bed. Carrie is wide awake. Here eyes focused across the room on her gorg wedding gown: ready and waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is standing in the hall putting on her earrings. bedroom door opens -- Carrie stands there in the wedding gown. Carrie and Miranda catch eyes for a brief moment. T are no words. Lily steps around from behind Carrie. She is wearing a lo white dress and holding a LITTLE PURSE. She looks adorabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are! Almost lost you under all that. Got your purse? Charlotte takes Lily's hand as Anthony comes out of the dining room and spots Carrie for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a bride! Flowers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flurry of activity -- attaching the veil on Carrie. Stanford stands near Carrie ready to assist if needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands in the pantry doorway watching -- eating a toasted bagel. Charlotte takes a bite -- carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose got a mirror?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind you. Carrie turns to move to the mirror. She is JERKED BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanford, you're on my dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off the dress!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a rip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?! Carrie's CELL PHONE RINGS. Anthony reaches over and picks up, distracted by the dress situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Big... pacing. He doesn't look rested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put Carrie on, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now... dress emergency. Anthony hangs up, tosses her phone onto the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage? What's the damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so much fabric I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see anything behind this friggin' table. Go, go -- everyone out into the hall. As the girls start out -- Anthony addresses Stanford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTHONY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a queen -- you should know how to step around a gown. STANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me a queen. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go -- Out in the hall, your highness. Everyone except for Lily moves out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's cell RINGS AGAIN. Lily picks it up, opens it and holds it up to her face -- She says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big is standing there. He hears only Lily breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Lily closes the cell phone. Big reacts, puzzled. She open her little purse, drops the phone in and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carries and company leave the building, JADED NEW YORKERS passing by react with awe at the beautiful sight. CHARLOTTE leads Lily over to HARRY who is waiting by the Sedan. He makes a fuss over how cute she looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big's driver RAOUL (55) is waiting out front next to his smoking. Big leaves his building talking on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Carrie... leave me a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you calling me back? I really need to talk to you. Call me back as soon as you get this. He closes phone. Raoul opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEDDING GUESTS arrive. Bitsy comes up to Stanford. A DRIV follows her carrying a LARGE box from TIFFANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like someone had breakfast at Tiffany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, look at the size... it's breakfast, lunch and dinner at Tiffany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BITSY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Gifts? Stanford chuckles as he points. She points to the DRIVER they walk away. Anthony comes over to Stanford. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem. STANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but for Carrie's sake I've decided to ignore your attitude. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, a real problem. They're not here. STANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're probably stuck in traffic. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanford gives a look of concern. Anthony nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big's car is parked in front of the library. Raoul is lea against it looking at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big is on the phone, smoking one of Raoul's cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Carrie, leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out front -- waiting. I can't go in without you. He takes a drag on the cigarette. Exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, this whole bride and groom thing has really thrown me. I need to know that it's still us. Just like you said. Me and you. Raoul KNOCKS on the window. Big looks out. The girls are the process of climbing out of the limo. Big closes the p and looks. Carrie gets out of the limo, her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around baby, let me see you. Just as he's about to see her face -- Charlotte pulls the veil over it. Carrie is gone -- all Big can see is a brid He sinks back into his seat and away from the window as t girls hurry up the library stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony and Stanford are waiting, as are Harry with Lily Magda with Brady, who is wearing a little tux with shorts knee socks holding a ring pillow. A FLURRY OF HIGH HEELS CLICKING on a marble floor is hear Carrie and the girls arrive around a corner. Magda GASPS, overjoyed when she sees Carrie in her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic was the worst --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda kneels to hug Brady. Samantha fluffs Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. We're ready. Samantha looks over. Anthony has a weird look on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The groom. Carrie lifts up her veil with ONE arm and looks out from under it. She is on super high-alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're twenty-five minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone call him? (beat; nothing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a phone. Someone give me a phone. Samantha hands her the iPhone. Carrie looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight/controlled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to work this. Stanford hands her a phone. As she dials she catches a WORRIED LOOK on Charlotte's face. Carrie turns away and h the phone to her ear, waits. Waits. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big is sitting in the car as it MOVES down a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been calling you for an hour. Why haven't you been answering your phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiety escaping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where my phone is! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was out front --but I just left. I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God -- Carrie drops the phone from her ear -- She's heard the wo The words on some level she was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming. Oh my God. The phone slips out of her hand and lands on the floor. Charlotte, Miranda, and Samantha don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean he's not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here. (beat; a plea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Get me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go. You take her. I'll stay here and deal with this -- She gestures to the wedding area. Miranda and Charlotte t Carrie's arms and quickly start moving her away. Horror o all of their faces. Brady CALLS after them, his voice ECH off the marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going, Mommy?! Samantha looks at Stanford and Anthony -- speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIMO DRIVER slams the limo door. Carrie is seen throu the window, sitting in back -- stunned. Miranda and Charl are in the back next to her -- stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big sits, pale, staring off as the car drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck am I doing? What the fuck am I doing? (to Raoul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around and go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a one way street. I have to go around the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time we go around the block she'll be gone. No one's behind us - - Turn around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big's car makes a QUICK three-point turn and starts back the one-way street as Carrie's limo turns onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raoul sees the limo -- coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over. Pull over. Big's car pulls over, as the limo approaches. Big powers his window -- as the limo passes, he sees Carrie in the window --resting her head against the glass, listless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie! Carrie looks up, and see's Big. He smiles an apologetical smile. Her limo keeps on moving. Big watches it go. Until

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo SCREECHES to a halt. The back door flies open an Carrie almost leaps out. Big sees her, he looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries up the street to Big's car holding her bouque Big gets out of his car just as Carrie reaches him. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I freaked out for a minute -- but -- I'm ready now -- Carrie HITS him with her bouquet. It's a violent direct h on his face. He recoils. She hits him again, hard... a wounded sound escaping her throat. BIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie! She hits him again. He ducks back into the car for protection. She hits the bouquet on the roof of the car - the flowers start breaking apart and flying everywhere. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you would do this -- I knew it! Miranda reaches Carrie and holds her back by her waist. B gets back out of the car and starts over to her. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I just -- With all she has left, she throws the broken bouquet at h CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left! I am humiliated! Carrie starts crying. Charlotte has arrived. Carrie turns falls into her arms. Miranda and Charlotte lead her away. starts over to follow. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, wait -- Charlotte whips her head around and stares him down. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He stops in his tracks. A WAITRESS (20's) at the Brant Pa Cafe nearby "over-pours" water into a CUSTOMER'S glass -- riveted by the scene. Miranda and Charlotte move Carrie b into the limo. A CAB comes down the street and HONKS at B standing in the road; dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits in a chair. She is holding a glass and has an Hermes blanket wrapped around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda sits nearby holding a bottle of vodka. Samantha paces, working on her iPHONE. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I would still be in extreme pain but I'm feeling nothing. Carrie reaches over and holds out her glass. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a little more nothing. Miranda nods and pours some more vodka into it... CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had gone from Little Women to Little Drunk Women. Charlotte enters and looks over at Carrie, soulfully. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm still jilted. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell got into him? He was perfectly fine at the dinner. Miranda sips her vodka -- should she say anything? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it when he called last night. I could tell. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say anything? She shrugs and sips. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't want to believe it. Didn't even want to say it out loud. (beat) And now I have nowhere to love -- (beat; then) I meant live. I have nowhere to live. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stay here. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sips. Charlotte looks at her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should eat something. She shakes her head. Charlotte looks at the others. CHARLOTTE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone hungry? They shake their heads; no. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you change your minds, I know where we can get one hundred beef, seventy-five fish and twenty- five vegetarian meals. She sips. Charlotte rubs her back. She sips. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my clothes. All my clothes. I can never go over there again. How am I going to get my clothes? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey -- I can hire people to do all that. Anything you need. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hit man? (beat) I have nothing to wear but a wedding gown. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your honeymoon stuff here. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the silver lining. A honeymoon to a romantic Mexican resort that's pre-paid on my credit card because I wanted to surprise the man who jilted me. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you out of that. Worse comes to worse -- I'll say there was a death or something. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't there? She sips, looking sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte leans down and tucks in the sleeping Lily. She picks up a "Chinese baby doll" and nestles it under Lily' arm, then turns and starts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is standing in the hall as Charlotte enters from Lily's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did something really bad -- I think. Charlotte looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said something to Big. At the rehearsal dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was right after Steve showed up. I was upset... Big came up to me -- and I said something like: You're crazy to get married. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just came out. Charlotte nods trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it was totally the reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her a break)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Big has been weird about marriage for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking I should tell Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. This is a really bad time to even mention it - no, no, no. Find another time. Later. Samantha comes down the hall. She is energized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, turns out, I couldn't get her out of the honeymoon -- but I got us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just booked us three seats on the flight. Mexico here we come. Charlotte and Miranda react; completely thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go to Mexico. I have a job. Samantha indicates Carrie -- sitting in the den staring o to nowhere, deeply sad -- Devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lush tropical road with a view of the sun setting on th ocean. A large open air GOLF CART comes around the bend holding the girls. Carrie's hair blows in the breeze, her sunglasses firmly in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous romantic private house surrounded by tropical splendor. The cart arrives in front. The DOORS are open a PAULO (38) the BUTLER stands there holding a tray with tw beautiful tropical drinks. He is surprised when he sees t four women, but he covers, effortlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenos dias. Carrie gets out of the cart and goes into the house -- followed by Charlotte and Miranda. Samantha arrives and p up a drink off the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I am confused. I am waiting for a Mr. And Mrs. Preston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you'll be waiting for a long time. She sips the drink, then looks at him, "familiar."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte and Miranda stand looking at the gorgeous, roma private Mexican bungalow. Samantha enters; looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... will kill her. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the powder room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands looking in the mirror. She takes off her sunglasses. Her eyes are red, red, red. She splashes wate her face and looks at herself in the beautiful Mexican mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulo leads Miranda, Charlotte, and Samantha into the romantic bedroom suite. On the bed -- rose petals are scattered in the shape of a large heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh My God! Miranda and Charlotte quickly grab the bed cover and jerk up -- throwing all the rose petals off. Paulo watches. Miranda addresses him in a very intense WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more honeymoon stuff. This is very important. Have I made myself clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie exits the powder room, her sunglasses in her hand. stands in the entry way; alone. She looks out at the main room; the beautiful view, the romance. Her eyes start to water. A PORTER enters with the bags. Carrie hides her fa acknowledging him with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters and moves directly to the bed, past Charlot where Miranda is sitting talking on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda -- I'll talk to you tomorrow Miranda hangs up as Carrie crawls onto the bed and lays d The pink sunset light floods across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a gorgeous sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the shutters. Paulo moves over to the window and starts closing the shutters. The sun is slowly shuttered out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them. Carrie closes her eyes. DARKNESS falls across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark except for the bright sunlight straining get in between the cracks of the closed shutters. Carrie asleep. Miranda sits on the bed. Carrie stirs, half wakin Miranda smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I dream it? Miranda shakes her head, no. Carrie closes her eyes, fall back asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Carrie is still asleep. Charlotte sits on the bed. gently shakes Carrie. Carrie opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, it's dinner time. You slept the whole day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Carrie closes her eyes. Charlotte exhales, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "tingling of glass" sound wakes Carrie. She opens her e and looks. Samantha is just sitting on the bed with a breakfast tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you have to eat a little breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat something and you can go back to sleep. Samantha holds up a bowl of yogurt. Carrie adjusts on her pillows a little. Samantha feeds Carrie a spoonful of yog Carrie looks at her. Samantha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, Miranda and Charlotte are sitting having lunch. Charlotte opens a pre-packaged "snack pack" chocolate pudding. She peels the lid off, takes a spoon and starts eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all this gorgeous fresh food you're just going to eat that pudding crap the entire trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only thing in the pantry that's totally safe. (holding up lid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. Made in Poughkeepsie. I don't want to chance it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a five-star resort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door opens. Carrie walks out. The sun hits he eyes. She squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four girls are laying in the sun in bathing suits rea magazines. Miranda re-adjusts her body, stretching out on beach chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun feels nice. Samantha looks over at her and notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, honey. Wax much? Miranda looks up at Samantha. Samantha indicates her swim crotch area...which is badly in need of a wax. Miranda gr her towel and covers her crotch area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What? I didn't know I was going to be in a swimsuit. Carrie and Charlotte look up from their magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to get a wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when -- 1998? Carrie looks away, resumes reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had other things on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be on death row and not have that situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you're married, Samantha -- you have a different set of priorities. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey don't blame marriage -- (re: Charlotte) This one's married -- and she's not growing a national forest. How do you even cross your legs? (beat) Let me make you a spa appointment -- Any thicker and you won't be able to find it. Miranda gets up from the chair and looks at her, mad. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what -- It's my fault?! I let the sex go out of our marriage! I deserve what I got. Thanks for understanding. She walks away. Samantha calls after her. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm sorry. That's not what -- MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine! Miranda goes inside. Carries throws her magazine down. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go down to the hotel for dinner on the beach tonight. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've got to do something to pull me out of my Mexicoma. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey... you made a little joke. Good for you. Samantha nods. Charlotte smiles; encouraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A romantic open-air restaurant on the beach. A MARIACHI B is serenading HONEYMOON COUPLES. A MALE HOST leads the gi across the small dance floor to their table. As they walk Miranda notices a slow dancing TWENTY-SOMETHING HONEYMOON COUPLE kissing -- very much in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carrie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look to your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. They arrive at their table and the host places down MENUS FELIX, (40) the waiter comes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenos notches. My name is Felix, I`ll be your server.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Felix)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix -- We'll start with quatro margaritas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not drinking. Just bottled water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drink hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have your room numbers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're staying in one of the private houses. Number three. He looks down onto a list he is holding, then up to Carri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Mrs. Preston. The waiter smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was like taking a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, Samantha, and Carrie look at the menu. Charlotte reaches into her purse and pulls out a little pudding and places it on the table. They all look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte had pudding in her Prada. Samantha laughs. Miranda smiles. Carrie looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I ever laugh again? (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When something is really, really funny. The Mariachi band strolls by playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god for that Mariachi band or I'd be able to hear my own thoughts. Felix re-enters with the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabulous -- and keep them coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food is on the table -- but Carrie, Miranda and Samantha mostly drinking. Charlotte is eating her pudding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After everything I know... After twenty years of everything we've learned -- I threw it all away for the thrill of putting his name on the honeymoon suite. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I met me now -- I wouldn't know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as long as we're going down this road. They look at her -- she sips her cocktail. SAMANTHA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe my life revolves around a man. On what planet did I allow that to happen? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love him. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean saying his name fifty times more a day than I say my own? Does it mean worrying about him and his needs before me and mine? Is it all about the other person? Is that love? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's marriage. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying marriage is a bad thing? Good to know right about now. Samantha looks down at her gardenia ring. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even this ring. I wanted to buy this for myself. That meant something to me. To be able to do that. Then, he buys it for me. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he knew how much you loved it. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But now, every time I look down at it... I see him. Not me. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could look at it and see a man who loves you and wants you to be happy. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you could look at it and see that. I'm Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter walks over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take another round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax -- we're on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically -- we're on my honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- I think we're on their honeymoon. She points to the TWENTY-SOMETHING COUPLE at a nearby tab who have progressed to graphic French kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (call to them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all so hot -- three days in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS are pretty much the only ones left in the restaurant. Empty drink glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't get out of the car. After everything he'd already put me through -- he couldn't make the effort and get out of the car? I made the effort -- I put a bird on my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that what that was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was just feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was a bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bad guy. Always was. Bad guys do bad things. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And good guys do bad things. The good guys screw you and the bad guys screw you. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the rest of them don't know how to screw you. Trust me-- I've done the leg work. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that was all Steve had -- didn't have money -- didn't have a career. He was the good guy bartender with a big dick. The all look over at her and react. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know this. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat your pudding. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine. Like -- nine and change. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Kinda balances off the one ball. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't forgive a man with a dick over nine inches? (off Miranda's "no") Well, honey, if you can't -- some other woman will. Felix comes up to the table. FELIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies -- the bar is closing. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Felix)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Preston will take the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a bottle of tequila. Charlotte's eyes widen. Felix nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAFF are stacking chairs -- The Mariachi band plays. Carrie, Miranda and Samantha are on the beach wading into water. Charlotte is just off the dance floor -- holding t shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go all the way in -- there may be sharks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, Miranda and Samantha are laying in the shade. Mir is working on her laptop. Carrie is cautiously studying h cell phone. She reads the message "window".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mail box full."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time like the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not ready to face it all yet. Carrie puts down the phone. Charlotte walks out of the ho wearing a workout outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going for a run and then to the gym for pilates. Anyone want to -- They all shake their heads: no. Charlotte trots away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news. Just got an e mail from your buyer's attorney -- they have agreed to sell you back your old apartment at that escalated price. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And "are willing to vacate by the time you return -- pending an additional financial offer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, apparently you can go home again -- but it'll cost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- lets work on getting your things there. Samantha picks up her iPhone and starts working as Mirand types an e mail response. Carrie watches them; touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two could rule the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is showering after her workout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After her workout Charlotte couldn't help but think about how truly blessed she was. This week had made her feel more grateful than ever for her happy marriage. Charlotte closes her eyes, lets the water flow over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while picturing her loved ones at home in New York, she forgot where she was... Charlotte opens her mouth, shower water goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And opened her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte suddenly realizes what she's done. She spits th water out. A panicked look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks along, looking refreshed. There's a GURGL sound in her stomach. Her eyes WIDEN. She walks quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is moving oddly. Walking on the balls of her fe She passes a WORKER who is pruning the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Miss. Charlotte shakes her head; not now. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Samantha sit reading. Charlotte hurries across patio -- a CRAZED LOOK on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie -- what's -- She shakes her head: NO and moves quickly to a door.   Sh tries the handle -- it's LOCKED. NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's locked -- Use the other-- Charlotte starts - but stops, cold. She has the look of a trapped animal on her face. Then - BAM, BAM, BAM, BAM. Charlotte's eyes WIDEN. They watch -- stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just like that, Charlotte Pookeepsed in her pants. Miranda opens the door and stands there.    Takes in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you   --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, shut up, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte duck waddles across the patio to the open door. Carrie, Samantha and Miranda look at each other. Carrie BURSTS out laughing. She laughs till her eyes water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda was right -- when something was really, really funny -- I laughed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits overlooking a magnificent view of the ocean. has her cell phone in her hand. She pushes a button and listens to the first message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First message. Received: Saturday, September twentieth; twelve-thirty P.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey babe -- I need to talk to you before you leave for the -- . Carrie impulsively THROWS her phone off the cliff. It sai through the air. The sun glistens off the pink crystals a falls to the ocean below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. A MANHATTAN STORAGE TRUCK drives away from the f of Carrie's building revealing... Carrie - standing in he front doorway. She exhales, turns and walks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE swings open the front door -- her living room is filled with boxes of her clothes, a few of her furniture pieces -- many, beautifully wrapped wedding gifts -- and wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no better time I could think of to hire and assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits across from A SPOILED LABEL QUEEN (22) wearin expensive clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm, no. I don't lift boxes. Yeah, definitely - No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE PARTY GIRL (34) Low cut blouse; very relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your books. You're shit's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Cathy... You seem drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bit. Never got to bed last night. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I type like a motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mousey BUSINESS GUY (23) in a tweed suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a degree in finance from Princeton and for the last two years I have been assistant to a V.P. at Merrill Lynch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polite/lost)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do you think you're right for this job? He glances at his feet. Carrie looks down. He is wearing heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise (22) African-American -- she holds a LOUIS VUITTON DENIM PURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're from St. Louis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Louise from St. Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie smiles, looks down at her resume. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been a personal assistant? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm the oldest of six kids, so I can pretty much handle anything you got. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six kids? What was that like? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded. I had to move to New York just to get some room. And where'd I wind up? A one bedroom apartment with three roommates. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs; then) Aside from the space issue... why'd you move to New York? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fall in love. Carrie is taken aback. LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's corny, right? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just -- so -- honest. I don't think I've ever heard anyone say that in a long time. Louise looks at her, owns it. Carrie smiles, sold. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Louise from St. Louis... I have just one more question. (beat) How does an unemployed girl with three roommates afford the Patchwork Denim Bowley Louis Vuitton bag? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's rented. "Bag, Borrow or Steal." It's like Netflix for purses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! How can I not know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, stick with me, I'll hook you up.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CARRIE'S APARTMENT-- DAY
dialogues.text: The room is now half-empty of the presents. Louise sits i the middle of the clutter -- busy writing out note cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she did hook me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space is much more orderly. Louise is kneeling on the floor taking books out of boxes and placing them on in pi on the floor. Carrie enters -- amazed at the progress. He phone rings. Louise answers it instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie Bradshaw... This is Louise. (listens; then repeats)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne From the New York Observer... She looks over at Carrie, who shakes her head: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let her know you called. She hangs up and continues working. Carrie watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise directs two DELIVERY MEN who are carrying a NEW MATTRESS into the bedroom. Carrie watches from her closet surrounded by boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After only three days -- I began to think of her as Saint Louise from St. Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is sitting at her desk, eating a take-out salad w talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) No, I can't be more patient. Your agency has had three weeks to find me an apartment. The office door opens -- A TWENTY-SOMETHING ASSISTANT ent and places some documents on the desk in front of her. Miranda signs as she chews and talks. MIRANDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I told you... It has to be in Manhattan. Because it does. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard could it be to find something just on the other side of the Brooklyn Bridge? The assistant takes the documents and starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On second thought -- Forget it. I could do a better job myself. Miranda hangs up, exhales. Bites her salad. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ethically diverse neighborhood with ethnically diverse PEOPLE. Miranda walks with Brady. A WIDE EYED Magda walks next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to New York Magazine, this is the new up-and-coming neighborhood. A CAUCASIAN YUPPIE DAD (32) with a BABY in a snugly comes of bodega. Miranda turns to Magda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! Wherever he's going is where we need to be. Miranda, excited about the hunt --picks up the pace follo after the dad. Magda hurries as best as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, Brady and Magda walk around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been here before -- This was all Ukrainian area. Miranda spots a U-HAUL truck parked in front of a buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming or going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO NYU-TYPE KIDS come out of a building carrying boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going. Oh boy. Lets go. She starts down the street with a clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda is standing out in front of the apartment building Brady. She looks -- A HOT LOOKING LATIN GUY (29) with tat is sitting on the stoop with a pitbull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda peeks into the empty apartment. Nice size, brick wall, big windows with a view of a colorful jungle gym on play ground across the street. Her heart starts racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda comes out of the building out of breath as the NY kids are going back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm interested in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand but -- who would I talk to about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The super. He points to a SIGN in LOBBY. The name: Lovro Klujcik and telephone number. Miranda writes it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovro... -- and I have no idea. (attempting to pronounce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ku...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kljuic. Lovro Klujcik. I know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were couple -- long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe her luck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- You dated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him since his wife died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's single? Magda shrugs as if to say: So what? Miranda smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spanish music plays. Two female HAIRDRESSERS work on two Dominican WOMEN CUSTOMERS. Magda sits under a hair dryer her top lip white with cream bleach. Miranda is next to h dialing on her cell. Brady plays nearby with two Dominica KIDS (5,6).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda stands at a gate and pushes the buzzer marked "Klujcik." A door under the stoop opens revealing LOVRO KLUJCIK, a Croatian man about Magda's age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... I told you on phone... the apartment is -- He looks past Miranda and sees Magda -- standing there wi brown hair and wearing make-up. His face lights up when h sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda?    Is this you? She smiles. Shy. He beams at her. He opens the gate, sayi something to her in his native tongue. Magda smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as Miranda wanted to pat herself on the back for finding her new apartment in just one afternoon... in the end, she knew --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda watches, thrilled as they converse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a Lovro connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA and SMITH have just finished making love. They a face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was really hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. You were kind of distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant? You're still in me. He gently moves off her and reclines next to her. SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about it? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When have I ever wanted to talk about it? SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll talk about it. Your best friends get screwed over by their guys -- how can you not get distant? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than that -- lately, I haven't been feeling a connection to -- SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Me? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- to -- it -- here. I have no real connection to our life here. SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What life here? Seriously -- all I do is work -- and you run off to New York every chance you get. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not every chance I get. Only for the A-list things. (beat; then) And my managing you -- it's all too much. I'm starting to resent it. For the last two years it's been all about you. SMITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for the first three years it was all about you. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. That was so much more fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we need to make an effort to reconnect -- spend more time together -- away from the business. Less me, less you -- More us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is on the phone, looking out at the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I won't be coming to New York for a while. We're going to spend some time reconnecting on the weekends... do the "LA couple thing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Carrie at a public pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hi, can you put on Samantha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. At first I was all: "You can't tell me what I can do" -- but then, I had to admit he had a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people and your relationships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please deposit another eighty-five cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, a pay phone? Where's your cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the ocean in Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to hook you up with a new one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet. No phone -- no calls, no calls-- no questions, no questions-- no explaining no wedding. Carrie puts coins into phone. She is wearing gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, It's an excuse to break out the gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Smith run into the surf in their wetsuits wi surfboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Samantha Jones decides to do something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Smith are starting to make love on the beach the waves crash on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... She does it all the way. A BEACHCOMBER with a metal detector, watches nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cooking class with other COUPLES. A CHEF watches as Samantha and Smith roll sushi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Smith did all the upscale L.A. couple things. Sushi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Smith stand next to each other wearing paper underwear. Two technicians spray tan them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Spray tanning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red carpet backdrop reads: HOLLYWOOD SAVES AFRICA Smith and Samantha are being photographed. She is wearing full-on African-inspired over the top fashion statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And saving Somalia... Samantha- style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sips a lattГ© while sorting through a stack of pap Louise is working on Carrie's computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie Bradshaw's web page is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Interesting -- so is Carrie Bradshaw. Louise laughs. Carrie sips her latte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- When are we going to get to the really important things like unpacking my closet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing at a time. Are you ever going to answer these emails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- I'll read -- you tell me what to do.(beat) Vitaminsforless. Delete. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So right. Louise deletes it -- Looks at next e mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's John@jjpny.com.? Carries freezes -- Louise looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit -- that's him, right? Carrie turns the lap-top around to face her and looks.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She clicks the email open; breathless. One sentence: "I don't know what to say." She swings the laptop back around to Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delete. Louise looks at her, unsure... then deletes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And -- isn't there some cyberspace place that you can send those so that I never have to see an email from him ever again? (off her nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want to end all communication with him? Carrie nods. Louise nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is reading Cinderella to Lily who sits in her lap. They are on Lily's bed - surrounded by her dolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And Cinderella and Prince Charming lived happily ever after." (beat; looks at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a fairy tall sweetheart. Things don't always happen like this in real life -- you should know that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again! Carrie flips back to the front. Lily is all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another one bites the dust. Charlotte walks into the den with her coat on. She smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommie home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks Carrie to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for watching her while I went to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling on coat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant. Carrie looks at her. Charlotte smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My doctor said sometimes when women stop trying -- it can happen. She knows other couples that adopt and then get pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie -- I'm pregnant! Happy, happy tears. Carrie hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess, in certain houses, fairy tales do come true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halloween costume aisle. Carrie and Miranda browse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're even dressing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the parents at Brady's school dress up -- it's fun! Fun thought up by a group of non-working mothers with nothing else to do all day. Miranda stops, looks at the costumes hanging there. MIRANDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witch and -- "sexy kitten". That's it? The only two choices for women. Witch and Sexy kitten. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said a mouthful there, sister. Miranda holds up a mask of a ghoul screaming in horror. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should just wear this and a business suit and go as myself. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re; mask) Speaking of monsters -- I got an email from Big. Miranda looks over at her. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I don't know what to say." (beat) Ah... then don't send an email. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you expecting? No idea. Miranda grabs a witch hat. They start walking aw They round a corner, CHILD wearing a mask pops up. CHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo! Carrie smiles. The child walks away. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna take a little more than that to scare me after what I have been through. They start walking toward the check-out counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the subject box: two words: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is all about "I'm sorry." I'm sorry emails -- I'm sorry voice mails -- I'm sorry flowers -- I'm sorry cards. How about: don't do anything to be: " I'm sorry" for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Big is too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point taken. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't believe this happened to me. I know it happened, but I can't believe it happened. I lay awake at night going over every detail of the last week in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie -- There's a detail I've been meaning to tell you about -- Carrie spots something; GRABS Miranda's arm with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I saw it...the only thing scary enough to scare me after the experience I'd been through. On the rack in the front register -- Vogue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Miranda stand looking at an open Vogue: "The Last Single Girl: Carrie Bradshaw Gets Married."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great, you look amazing. So. That's the worst of it. Carrie flips a page. She noticed something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- what's that say? In the box at the end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Editor's note: The wedding of Carrie Bradshaw and John James Preston was cancelled as this issue went to press. Carrie Bradshaw is... Miranda stops reading.   Carrie looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is what? Miranda doesn't want to respond. Carrie pushes the magazi further away so she can read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Carrie Bradshaw is still single and living in Manhattan."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wind kicks up, autumn leaves blow. Carrie walks down th street, the Vogue under her arm, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to buy it - but I figured it was one less Vogue in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's door opens. Charlotte stands in the hall with Li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it. The pictures are gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- I'm a beautiful bride. Come in. They walk in, Carrie closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the people who don't know -- will only see the beautiful pictures. The people who do know will only see what an asshole he is. (beat; to Lily) Mommy said a bad word. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks down to Lily) Hi, honey. Lily holds up a little baby pumpkin to Carrie. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me? Lily nods. Carrie has to lighten up. She kneels to Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are you going to be for Halloween?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinderella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or -- we also brought Mulan. Lily shakes her head: NO. Carrie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to go trick or treating with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in our building -- if you feel up to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (How can I not?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie knocks on Charlotte's front door. It opens. Charlo stands there -- dressed as a cute cow. With udders on her belly. Harry is Uncle Fester. Lily is Cinderella in a MAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No costume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look closer. I'm the scariest thing in New York. Jilted at Forty-one. Boo. Harry Laughs. So does Charlotte...even Carrie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the hall. Carrie is holding Lily's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you have to give me some of your loot, right? Lily nods Carrie smiles. Harry knocks on a door. It opens PARK AVE WOMAN (40), stylish - stands there with treats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trick or treat! The woman smiles -- then suddenly, her smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Carrie, I saw Vogue -- I'm so sorry. Carrie reacts, mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another door opens. A PREPPY WOMAN (36) is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trick or treat! REVEAL: Carrie's face -- hidden behind the Cinderella mas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STYLIST is blowing out a woman with dark chestnut brown hair. Reveal the woman's face: It's Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining outside. Louise walks in, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise! Double-take. Carrie is waving to her from a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Lord. I did not even recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point. My head is the witness protection program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really feeling that look on you. Louise reaches into her purse to get something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am feeling that Balenciaga on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine till Tuesday. Louise pulls out a cell phone and holds it out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- time to re-join the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already? Louise nods. Carrie takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your new number... area code: 347 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold, Hold, Hold. 347? No, no. I'm a 917 gal. Always have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No longer available. Now, you're 347.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now even I don't recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha sits on her deck. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie Bradshaw --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Carrie walking along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Or I used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a 347 area code. How tacky is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 347 is the new New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the old New York with the old 917 and my old will to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old New York, new New York -- honey -- at least it's New York. She looks -- Dante is coming out of the surf in his wetsu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another hard thing about being in L.A? My "sex on a stick" next door neighbor. I can't stop looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking. After I saw Steve's face at the rehearsal dinner, I could never --- Dante notices her on the deck. He gives her a sexy smile. She doesn't acknowledge it -- turns away and walks inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you should see this guy. Every night sex with a different partner. He's like -- (searching then realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Me. Five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   When I was a 212.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha strolls along Rodeo Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in an effort to stay out of her house and out of trouble -- Samantha went shopping. She notices a sidewalk "dog rescue station." Cute puppies frolic and play in a wire pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of the pen sits a tattered tiny DOG.   Alone. Samantha can't help but look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly wasn't the cutest dog in the pen - but their was something about it -- The dog looks up at her -- Dark marks under its eyes. The Rescue Woman (40) notices Samantha looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs a good a home. Interested? Samantha shakes her head; "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just as Samantha convinced herself that the dog wasn't for her. The dog starts humping a stuffed animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been fixed, but she hasn't lost the urge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha holds the dog while talking to two GROOMERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she needs a little eye work. Anything you can do about these stains? The dog looks up at her. She looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I don't mince words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and the dog walk out of Gucci in matching outfit looking fabulous. Three GUCCI SALESMEN follow them holdin large Gucci bags. They walk to her sleek Mercedes SUV -- parked at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT TO: The back of the Mercedes SUV filled with shopping bags: Gucci, Prada, Dior -- the SUV hatch is clo revealing Samantha's licence plate: I HEART NY. Samantha pulls away, the dog in her lap -- fur blowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Louise are in the closet unloading clothes fro the boxes. Carrie opens a wardrobe box -- It's the WEDDIN GOWN. They both look at it - not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to get rid of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's too beautiful. I'll just bury it deep in the back -- like I did my feelings. Carries closes the box back up. Louise watches; then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day. You know, it's weird -- I haven't cried very much at all. Maybe you're only allotted a certain amount of tears per man -- and I used mine up. Carrie gently pushes the box away. Opens another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know how you feel `cause, my college boyfriend broke up with me last year. And I miss him all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it dawned on me -- there were two broken hearts in my-walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise -- we need a cocktail. Grab your rental. Carrie starts out. Louise grabs her purse and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Louise are having cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it threw me so hard `cause, you know, I thought Will -- that's his name... was the love of my life. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he loved me and all -- but didn't think I was "the one". Carrie looks at her, nods. LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that hurt. But -- you know -- whatever. I'm not going to give up on love. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love is the thing, you know. She holds up her key chain. The word "Love" in gold. LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that. I'm bringing it to me all day long. Louise gets a "text".  She reaches over and looks.     Sh smiles as she reads it. Carrie raises her eyebrow. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I remember that smile.   Who's the guy? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone I just met. He wants me to meet him for a drink. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 11:30?     That's a bootie call. LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not like that... he just got off work -- he's a waiter. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, I may not get texts and I may not send texts -- but trust me: The sub-text of that text: Bootie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise nods, then starts texting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not a bootie call if he meets me.... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then. You kids enjoy. That's what your twenties are for. Your thirties are to learn the lessons. Carrie stands up, throws some money on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your forties are to pay for drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte sits on the couch, reading a magazine. The thre dogs near her. Harry enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going for your run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't go yesterday either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like running!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Welcome to the house of hormones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Charlotte walk looking at furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about the desk. If I find the desk, the writing will come. And it better `cause I'm using my new book advance to pay the fancy decorator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's so great that you are re-doing your entire apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out with the old -- (looks at price tag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- In with the overpriced. Charlotte smiles. Carrie links arms with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry called me and mentioned you're not running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause he loves you... and he's concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing to be concerned about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the doctor say it wasn't safe or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she said because I'm already a runner -- it's fine. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why are you not -- CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid something bad will happen. It's a miracle that I'm even pregnant. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if the doctor said -- CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not rational, Carrie... it's irrational. I know that. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got everything I ever wanted. I'm so happy -- I'm terrified. (beat) No one gets everything they want. Look at you. Look at Miranda. You're such good people and look what happened to you. Of course, something bad is going to happen to me. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, you shit your pants this year. Maybe you're done. Charlotte laughs a little. Carrie moves her along. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run   every day -- that's what you do.   You can't stop being who you are   -- just because you're afraid.   Right? Charlotte nods, they walk on, linked together. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's get down to business. I've got to have my apartment done in time for that baby shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUTUMN LEAVES fall as Charlotte walks onto the running tr with the three dogs on leashes. She starts to run -- tentative -- slowly. They trot along with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte runs faster - more confident. The dogs run alon with her -- they are wearing Burberry pet sweaters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the last of the autumn leaves fell away -- so did Charlotte's fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWFLAKES float down. Charlotte, dressed for winter runs form -- alone. A smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits at her card table "temp" desk. Louise is sort through a stack of mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want me to RSVP to some of these holiday parties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
