dialogues.text: Yep. I'm perfectly happy spending time home alone. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And speaking of home -- you're going to miss your plane. Louise takes a gift wrapped present out of her purse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas. It's just something silly. Carrie opens it. A DVD of "MEET ME IN ST. LOUIS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Louise from St. Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you never saw it -- so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I feel bad. If I had known we were going to exchange gifts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie gets up and RUNS to her closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have bought you one two weeks ago and hidden it in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes back out with a large circular BOX tied with sa ribbons. It says: Louis Vuitton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That is not what I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Lord. Oh my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens it and SCREAMS as she pulls out a gorgeous purs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more rent girl for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise throws it over her shoulder and walks "runway."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's home from the big city!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the best money I'd ever spent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie comes out of her kitchen, holding a Cup O'Soup. Sh wearing pajamas and socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Year's Eve... and a Cup O'Soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plops in a chair in front of the TV. She picks up the "Meet Me in St. Louis" DVD and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is standing in the open doorway -- with his coat an hat on. Miranda is kneeling -- putting a winter coat on Brady. A Christmas tree glows behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are you gonna say at midnight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- but you gotta say it more excited than that -- (then; excited) "Happy New Year!" BRADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year! MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that and then... you kiss. She gives him a big kiss. He laughs. She stands. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all ready to go, B-boy? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pack the new Batman Santa brought you? Brady shakes his head: NO. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw man -- Gotta have the new Batman. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's there near the tree. Brady leaves to get it. Steve looks over at Miranda. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got plans with the girls? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all kinda staying in tonight. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come and eat with us? We can go somewhere over here on your side. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda -- I never meant to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks away. Brady comes up back to them with Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hat on. It's snowing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady nods and takes Steve's hand.   Steve looks over at Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence... then, Miranda bends down and gives Brady a big sloppy kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up and closes the door. As it closes, Steve lo at her. Finally; it is closed -- she leans against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sips soup watching a "deliriously in love" Judy Garland sing "The Trolley Song."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZING ZING ZING WENT MY HEARTSTRINGS THE MOMENT I MET HIM -- I FELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, not in the mood, picks up the remote -- clicks. T TV goes off. She looks around: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits at her makeshift desk as snow falls outside h window. She looks down at the computer; motionless. CLOSE SCREEN: The only thing written on it is the word: "Love." After a beat Carrie types three dots. She thinks, then deletes two of the dots. Her phone rings. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanford sits in a festive booth with festive FRIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year -- We're having a fabulous time. The only thing missing is you. Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet but I can't, I'm writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Okay. (beat;then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not really writing are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're not really having a fabulous time are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Rescue me. It's very forced festive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, that's just what every New Year's Eve party needs: a visit from the lost Bronte sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Better a Bronte sister than a Hilton sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks but -- by ten PM I'll be in bed asleep and blissfully unaware of how fabulous this night is supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is sound asleep. Her phone rings. She grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Miranda -- sitting on her couch watching th New Year's Eve coverage on television. Chinese take-out i the table in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought one of the perks of having a family is you don't have to spend New Year's Eve alone with Chinese food. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alone with Chinese food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit -- I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. Where's Brady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Steve's night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep -- don't wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine -- I was just getting a little choked-up watching the stupid New Year's Eve stuff on TV alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to come over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all the way downtown --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can grab a cab --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On New Year's Eve? No way. I'm fine... really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to talk a little. Go back to sleep. Good night. Miranda hangs up. Carrie lays there -- holding the phone. She looks over at her bedside table clock: 11:12. She thi then -- throws back the covers and gets out of bed. START MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowing. Carrie hurries out of her front door -- a coat thrown over her pajamas. She comes down the stairs to the street looking for a cab. Nothing. No traffic. She starts RUNNING up the block -- passing TWO FESTIVE COUPLES; walk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily, in her PJ's, is marching around the den wearing a "Happy New Year" party crown and blowing into a party fav horn. Harry and Charlotte -- wearing New Year's Eve party hats -- sit on the couch -- laughing. Charlotte and Harry kiss. His hand moves sensuously down Charlotte's body and rests on her pregnant belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Smith recline on the couch. They are wearing sexy black robes and having caviar and champagne. The Dog sits nearby... a fire roars in the fireplace behind them. Samantha and Smith kiss on the couch. The Dog humps a pil nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda and Lovro sit in a booth, they toast with sherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony stands talking to FRIENDS. Someone taps him on th shoulder. He looks over -- it's Stanford -- holding two glasses of champagne. Stanford and Anthony look at each other as everyone around them kisses. Stanford presents h cheek. Anthony kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowing. Carrie runs up the stairs of the Lower East Side subway stop. She looks around to get her bearings -- then starts running again. She passes a GROUP OF TWENTY-SOMETH PEOPLE blowing party horns and LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is talking to a group of St. Louis FRIENDS. She lo up as WILL (22) her handsome African-American ex-boyfrien enters. Their eyes meet. Her heart stops. He smiles. She smiles. He starts over to her. They stand talking -- she smiles. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A festive, crowded restaurant. Sitting at the bar, next t small Christmas tree... is Mr. Big, eating alone. Big loo up from the bar -- watching couples kiss all around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Brady are in bed... asleep.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LOWER EAST APARTMENT DAY
dialogues.text: Miranda opens a fortune cookie -- and reads it. Tosses it down. Picks up another -- cracks it open. Reads it. Tosse down. She looks like she might cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie rounds the corner of Miranda's street and runs up her building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda opens the door -- Carrie is standing there -- out breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times Square is seen on the television in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5-4-3-2-1.     Happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Miranda look at each other. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda and Carrie sit on the couch -- eating -- they are LAUGHING. END MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow on the ground -- COLD. CROWDS gathered in front of t large fashion tent. Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte and Samant trudge through the snow to the stairs. Samantha is wearin lots of fur. She SLIPS on some ice -- Carrie catches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks -- Three months driving in L.A. and I forgot how to use my fucking legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every year the women of New York leave the past behind and look forward to the future... this is known as Fashion Week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way up the stairs to the tent entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is buzzing with PRESS and CROWDS OF FASHIONISTA The GIRLS enter and make their way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. I hear the couture calling my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this -- this is what I miss. Last night Smith and I cuddled in front of the TV with "take out" Mexican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- In your four billion dollar                          beach house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still -- I don't think I'm cut out                      for the one-on-one relationship thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been doing it for five years. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, see -- I've always had girlfriends on the side. They smile. Miranda spots MAYOR MICHAEL BLOOMBERG across room. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Mayor Bloomberg.                              SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Yorkers are so damn attractive -                  - Even the Mayor is hot.                              MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe that was his last                           campaign slogan.                                      The girls walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is filling up and buzzing with FASHIONISTAS as t girls make their way. Samantha spots her name on four cha in the front row and leads the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the front row?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pulled some strings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go thank them -- Samantha throws her coat on her chair back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decide where we want to go for lunch -- I'll make the call. (beat; excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like old times. Samantha hurries off, excited. Carrie, Miranda and Charlo settle into their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is how you all spent your Saturdays while I was with Brady and Steve at the Brooklyn Aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Not every Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know -- We always had front row at the mammal show. (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve does the funniest dolphin impression. Actually, it's more -- Steve as a dolphin -- A smile escapes her -- they look at her. Her smile fades. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really can't forgive him? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting something? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Steve. I've always liked Steve -- He's apologized a hundred times -- he's not seeing anyone else. What's it going to take? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are you also suggesting that she forgive Big? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I could kill Big. Sometimes when I'm running -- I imagine what I'd say if I ever saw him again. I have the perfect opening sentence. Want to hear it? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (duh?) Ah.... yes. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I curse the day you were born. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive. Better work up a hand gesture to go with it. Elaine comes up to Carrie, squats down in front of her. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god you're here. They have me covering this Mercedes-Benz fashion week and I'm desperate for a Carrie Bradshaw-esque quote. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll do my best. We'll talk after? ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. And -- ooh -- my back -- She gets up -- sits in Samantha's empty chair next to Car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Can I just say that I'm so sorry about what happened with your wedding. Carrie smiles -- what else can she do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you survived it. I, personally, was so devastated I took myself off JDate -- but you survived and you're here and you look amazing and I just think that's so great. Everyone in my row does -- we can't stop talking about it. Okay -- Meet you in the lobby after. Elaine smiles and leaves. Carrie sits -- stunned; numb. S looks to the chairs across the runway -- FASHIONABLE WOME are looking back at her -- one or two smile sympathetical She grabs her things and then turns to Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta go. Carrie slips silently away. Charlotte gets up and starts after her. Miranda looks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I -- Charlotte shakes her head: "not sure"... and continues away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte catches up with Carrie as she is about to exit. Fashionistas stream by them on their way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, wait. Carrie stops -- turns around -- putting on her wrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a mistake -- it's too soon -- I'm not ready. I'll go get a coffee and you guys call me after -- and I'll meet you for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I know how much you were looking forward to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I really was... until I became the poster child for wounded women everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this thing going to effect everything I do for the rest of my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- but if you leave right now -- it will effect the rest of your day. Carrie looks at her -- takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Fashion Week. We're in the front row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where everyone can see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares about them -- You only came for the clothes. Carrie smiles... a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's hard but -- It's like you said: You can't stop being who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Miranda have just gathered their things and leaving their chairs as Charlotte and Carrie return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought we were leaving. Charlotte shakes her head: NO. Samantha and Miranda turn around and start back to their seats as -- MUSIC STARTS.. LIGHTS CHANGE. The girls settle in just as a MODEL starts down the RUNWAY in gorgeous clothes. Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte and Samantha watch -- DISSOLVE TO: the girls watching another model; another outfit. They point and discuss what they see -- loving it DISSOLVE TO: the girls watching another model; another outfit. With each outfit Carrie seems to lighten and brighten. DISSOLVE TO: the girls watching another model; another outfit. Carrie smiles as she watches -- now, truly enjoyi herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is being interviewed by Elaine holding a TAPE RECORDER. Miranda, Samantha and Charlotte watch nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if it was the fashion or the fact that the four of us were together again -- but for the first time in a long time -- I felt like myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls leave the tent and start down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a cab -- I am starv -- SPLAT. Her fur coat is hit with SPLASH of red paint. They REACT: SHOCKED. AN ACTIVIST WOMAN stands there holding a paint cup. Next to her -- another ACTIVIST is holding a P dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fur is murder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I miss New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie hurries across the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a couple of weeks later -- I met St. Louise's St. Louis boyfriend, Will. She arrives at the front of a restaurant. Through the win she can see Louise sitting next to Will. Louise spots Car and waves. Carrie waves back and starts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Christmas they realized how much they loved each other. Just in time for Valentine's day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns the key in her mail box. A little pink envel sits there. She takes it out and opens it. It's a "kid's style" Valentine card of Cinderella. She turns it over. Lily's crayon mark mixes with Charlotte's handwriting: To Aunt Carrie... Love, Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door, holding the valentine. Her phone i ringing. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Samantha in her kitchen attempting to make sushi. Her hands covered in rice. The DOG, wearing a swea with a "heart" on it sits on the floor watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just calling to make sure you aren't hanging from your shower rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called an hour too early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's the V-day plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda and I are going to dinner and then a really violent slasher movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am making Smith sushi. Pause for reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Do you make sushi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took a class a while back -- and when he walks in the door at seven- thirty, I am going to surprise him by laying on the dining room table - -- covered with homemade sushi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you do have time on your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks over to the book shelf and places the Cinder valentine on it. She looks down at the bottom shelf. The Vogue magazine is looking up at her -- She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, village restaurant festively decorated for Valentine's Day. Pink balloons float on the ceiling, thei red ribbon strings hang at eye level. Carrie and Miranda at a table. At all the other tables -- Couples!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it me or is Valentine's Day this year on steroids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was like this last year but we played for the other team. A WAITRESS (23) approaches them with pink menus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. Here's our special Valentine night menu. All the selections are romantic in theme and designed to be split for two. Are you having wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass or a bot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back to take you and your girlfriends order. The waitress leaves. Miranda looks at Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could do a lot worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wine bottle is now empty. Carrie and Miranda eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you look at the Vogue today of all days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause -- I'm an emotional cutter. (Beat;then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserve what I got. Running all over New York believing that I'm finally getting my happy ending. "See everyone, love does conquer all. Look at me in my one of a kind wedding gown marrying the love of my life." Waitress stops at the table. She picks up the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like another bot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Miranda... in that article -- I did not say "we" once. It was all: "I" want and "I" think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was from your point of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point of view... Exactly. The whole wedding was my point of view. I let the wedding get bigger than Big. I am the reason he didn't get out of that car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't put this all on yourself. (beat; then) Okay. I said something I shouldn't have said to Big at the rehearsal dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was really upset after Steve showed up and I bumped into Big and -- I said that you two were crazy to get married. Carrie is stunned. The waitress arrives with the new bott of wine. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. Your Shiraz. She is opening the bottle. Tension. She pops the cork -- starts to pour. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop -- It's fine -- Thanks. The Waitress puts the bottle down and walks away. MIRANDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I was upset-- Steve had-- CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been going over this and over this in my mind for five months -- and -- for five months you kept a secret like that? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to tell you once but the Vogue article came out -- CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once? You tried to tell me once? You should have tried to tell me every single day! MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I was looking for the right time. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no right time to tell me you ruined my marriage! The Room is now at "attention."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just happened -- I wasn't thinking. Carrie grabs her purse -- to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, please -- Don't go -- I -- Carrie stands up -- the festive balloon strings bob in fr of her face. She pushes them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think what hurts the most is that you kept a secret from me. I have never ever kept a secret from you. Ever! She starts out. Stops, comes back -- through the ribbons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm lying. For the last five months I've been thinking that it's a huge mistake that you left Steve. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. How does it feel? She turns and pushes balloons out of her way as she start out. A KISSING COUPLE (20's) is BLOCKING her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me! They stop -- She squeezes by them. Miranda is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles are lit. Samantha enters wearing a sexy sheer rob and carrying a giant tray of homemade sushi. The phone ri The machine picks up. Smith leaves a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe -- we're way behind on set. I still haven't been released. I'll get there as soon as I can. She SIGHS -- places the tray on the table. Looks at the w clock: Seven-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock. Samantha is sitting in the robe near the table. Not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight-thirty -- Samantha is pacing. She takes a piece of sushi -- pops it in her mouth and chews -- pissed. A WOMA MOANING is heard. She walks over and glances out the wind into Dante's living room. Candles are everywhere -- he is naked and GIVING HEAD to naked BLONDE WOMAN. She is writh in pleasure. Samantha watches -- even more pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the same Valentine night Samantha had planned -- minus the sushi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha now wearing sweat clothes, sits with her arms crossed -- waiting. The door opens and Smith enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm home! He see's Samantha sitting there. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that was a long day -- the crew went into double overtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are three hours late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bummer. I know. Did you eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I ate. I ate the sushi that I hand made for you. The sushi that I planned to lay all over my naked body as a Valentines surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so upset? I called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slaved away in a kitchen all day to make this meal for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made some sushi -- it's not a big deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a big deal? She stands up. She picks up some pieces of sushi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this -- This took me five fucking hours! She throws sushi at him. He dodges them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not the type of woman who sits home all day waiting for a man! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love California so much -- enjoy your hand-made California roll! She throws more sushi and storms out. Smith looks at the subzero fridge. A sushi piece slides down the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLORAL ARRANGEMENT sits on the hall table next to the answering machine. A card reading: "I'm sorry -- Miranda" nearby. The answering machine is recording an incoming ca from Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Pick up. Are you there? Carrie is standing in the bathroom; looking out at the answering machine, brushing her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days of "I'm sorry" calls and e-mails and flowers -- and I still wasn't ready. It was the longest we'd even gone without speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain. Carrie walks up to her stoop. A CAB idling in front The cab window goes down. Miranda is sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie. Carrie looks. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been waiting here? Miranda looks to the meter, then back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen dollars long. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please get in. It just turned to eighteen. Carrie looks at her, hesitates, starts over to the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours down the windows. Carrie and Miranda sit in silence. A MIDDLE EASTERN DRIVER sits behind the wheel. CLOSE ON: THE METER. It reads 22.00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird not talking. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm upset. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, I understand -- but it just happened -- I never meant to hurt you. (beat) You have to forgive me. Carrie looks over at her. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. What were you going to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You badger me to forgive you in three days -- and you won't even consider forgiving Steve for something he did six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's forgiveness. Miranda thinks -- Carrie looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And -- I know you're not the reason my marriage fell apart. I was just - desperate to have someone else to blame. Miranda thinks. The METER clicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Miranda are sitting in front of a THERAPIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can trust that it won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERAPIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve - you're very quiet today. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, I know I made it hard for you to trust me. But -- You made it hard for me to trust you. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you treated me and cut me out of your life like that? I mean, yeah -- I broke a vow. But what about the other vows? Like promising to love someone for better or for worse? What about that? Miranda looks down at her hands. Steve looks at the therapist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know she won't punish me for the rest of my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't. And she doesn't know for sure that you won't have another indiscretion. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you can know... is that you want to move forward and risk that you love for each other won't allow that to happen. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what we'll discover here. Steve looks over at Miranda. Miranda looks at Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forsythia bushes are in bloom. Carrie and Miranda walk. T carry sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're done with our last session and we're not allowed to talk for two weeks while we figure out if being together again is something we really want. And then - - we had to pick a place to meet -- and if we both show up on that day - - the past no longer exists. Showing up is the promise we make to each other that we're willing to let it all go and move forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do that? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I have a lot of thinking to do. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking -- or feeling? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda -- you're a lawyer. You can argue both sides of any case -- but, why we feel what we feel -- isn't logical. It's emotional. Sorry, Harvard -- I'm afraid you're going to have to make this decision based on your emotions. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then -- I'm screwed. I don't know what I feel. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. There will come a moment when you'll know. And if it's: yes - - all that brilliant logic will go out the window... with the past. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought picking the place to meet was a challenge. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brooklyn Bridge. Halfway between both our places. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very logical. And yet poetic. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetic -- if we both show up. Otherwise -- you're on a bridge -- rejected. Not a good plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks in carrying a Starbucks cardboard caddy with coffee. Louise is sitting at her desk, working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two pieces of good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have two coffees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got a heads-up from your realtor. The apartment on Fifth finally sold. Carrie sips coffee. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have sixty days before the new owner takes possession and you are out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the other news? Louise holds up her hand. There is a diamond ring on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving back to St. Louis -- we are getting married in the fall. Louise beams. Carrie hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey day. Samantha is sitting on the beach reading "The Secret."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, back in Lost Angeles... She rolls her eyes, and tosses it down in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha walks on the beach. The dog is walking with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Samantha had money, a career and a man who loved her... Still, she couldn't shake the feeling that something was missing from her life. The dog runs up onto the neighbor's deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is on the neighbor's deck looking for the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, baby? She rounds a corner -- and comes face to face with Dante showering in the outdoor shower. Water runs over his NAKE and PERFECT BODY. He sees her and smiles a hot smile. She thrown -- overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I'm your neighbor and my dog ran up on your dick-- (catching herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Deck! There is a GROWL sound. She looks -- the dog is humping a towel on the deck floor. She looks back at Dante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to join me? Speechless -- She shakes her head: No -- she scoops up th dog and hurries away. He calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dante.     Stop by -- anytime. Samantha takes a peek back and continues on her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is having lunch outside while on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith is interested - but the dates will have to work with the series. Dante appears on the deck next store in a wet suit. He un it while looking at Samantha. SAMANTHA dips a chip in guacamole and eats it. He pulls his wet-suit down and smi at her. She dips another chip. He steps out of it and loo at her -- almost torturing her. She looks the other way, another chip in guacamole and eats it. Then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is in the kitchen on the phone. She picks up a s of messy pizza from a delivery box on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We agreed that no one else from the show but Smith was going to be on the cover. She walks to the window and looks out. Dante is on his de putting on sun screen. He glistens. She chews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is in the jacuzzi -- she is looking up at Dante is on his deck smoking a joint. He indicates for her to c over. She shakes her head: No. He walks away. She presses button on the control panel. The jacuzzi jets start. She positions herself "on" them, then... She reaches over and grabs a giant hot fudge sundae and... starts eating it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda sits in the window -- having a cappuccino, alone. the table a legal pad with a list of PROS and CONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her two weeks just about up, Miranda's list of pros and cons were equal. She throws some money down on the table and takes a final on her cappuccino. As she stands up, she catches sight of herself in the mirrored wall. Cappuccino foam covers her lip. She remembers. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda stands on the bridge. Alone. She looks at her wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suddenly dawned on Miranda that Steve's list might have had more cons then pros. Just as this reality hits -- the CROWD parts and Steve is seen RUNNING up the bridge... towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda and Steve walk along the bridge towards Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Miranda never looked back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Miranda are making love -- it is passionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, almost never. Miranda turns her head back to look at Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's apartment is transformed. It is sleeker, polishe more grown-up, with a warm, modern feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at home -- everything felt and looked different -- and yet still very much me. Carrie -- BLONDE again -- walks out of the kitchen with Lilacs in a large vase. The door bell buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door. Miranda stands there with a very pregnant Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. This is a very exclusive party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the list. Miranda Hobbes plus one...and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMEN FRIENDS chatting and having fun. The front door is and a coat rack is visible in the hall. A couple of WAITE (20's) move around. ANTHONY comes up to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman just put a glass down on your new desk without a coaster. I told her if she did it again I'd break her arm. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. He walks on. Miranda wanders up to Carrie. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Samantha? Her plane landed two hours ago. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her, probably ran to the hotel gym for a quick work-out. Samantha appears in the doorway wearing a summer coat -- dog is in her purse. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no place like home. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie! They kiss -- She goes to Miranda; they kiss. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a rat in your purse. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that rat better be house trained. A CATER WAITER walks over to her. CATER WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take your coat? Samantha nods and takes off her coat. Revealing: She has belly. A very non-Samantha big fat gut. Carrie looks at it. Miranda looks at it. Carrie and Miran exchange looks. Charlotte comes running down the hall. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha! Samantha raises her arms to greet her. Her blouse rides u the gut peeks out. Charlotte reacts; shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a -- dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever think you'd see the day -- me with a pooch. All three shake their heads: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, Miranda, and Charlotte are in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, she has a belly. So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, a belly on anyone else is a "so what?" A belly on Samantha is a: "So what the hell is going on?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never mentioned it on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. And when has she ever not talked about every detail regarding her body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we even bring it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- like a fat intervention? "We love you -- have a salad?" No. We should let her bring it up. There is a knock... Samantha opens the door. She's eating piece of cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, we can talk about my gut later-- right now, I'm bored to tears here. She gives them a look. They smile, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has left. Samantha is sitting with Charlotte and Miranda and Carrie. They are having coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I eat -- so I won't cheat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are you eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything except Dante's dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Language, please -- this is a grown- up apartment now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I didn't realize how big I was until I saw it on your faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How -- and I say this with love -- How could you not realize it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been avoiding mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you for not cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if there's anything to be proud of. I stuff my face to stop myself from doing something that feels natural to me. Carrie reaches over and rubs Samantha's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I didn't want to admit it. And when you're in denial -- you don't dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen -- this isn't about the weight. You'd be gorgeous at any size. But are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Silence; then) Relationships aren't always about being happy, right? (beat) How often do you feel happy in your relationship? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlotte) I'm pretty sure that's to you. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel happy ever day? CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all day -- everyday -- but everyday. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you felt happy? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months ago. They react. SAMANTHA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does your gut tell you? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but -- (beat; hard) Smith stayed with me through chemo. If he could stay with me through that, I should be able to stay in this relationship for him. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie... You just compared your relationship to chemo. Samantha looks at her, then Charlotte, then Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we were...the three mirrors Samantha couldn't avoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Samantha? Samantha looks. Carrie points. The dog is humping a pillo Carrie's furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That pillow cost three hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is sitting -- waiting. Smith enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- You're home! I thought you were staying the week. He kisses her. She looks at him. Touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwww... man. I knew this was coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This isn't working. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done my best. I've given it five years and fifteen pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- You don't love me any more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I love you - ah, fuck it -- I'm just gonna say the thing you're not supposed to say -- I love you but I love me more. And I've been in a relationship with myself for forty-nine years and that's the one I need to work on. She stands up and wraps her arms around him, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find a wonderful woman who loves being in a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But that's a risk I'm willing to take. She notices the gardenia ring on her finger. She starts t take it off. Stops. Looks back up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm keeping this. Every time I look down at it I want to think of you. She kisses him on the lips. GENTLY. SOFTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha sits in first class. She is crying... while eati hot fudge sundae. A STEWARDESS leans down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're landing in new York. I'm gonna need to take that now. Samantha nods, and finishes eating the hot fudge sundae a fast as she can. Scraping, almost licking the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As someone returned to my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands at the door with Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Someone left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I put all the unopened mail from your P.O. Box in the manila envelopes on the bottom shelf there. She points to the shelf in the new bookcase. Carrie looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please -- please do not make a mess of CarrieBradshaw.com -- it's my masterpiece. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do without you? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find some other girl... but she won't have my style. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Louise, you brought me back to life. Emotion floods Carrie; she chokes up. So does Louise -- LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you gave me Louise Vuitton. Carrie laughs -- they hug. LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious. We need to stop cryin'. Louise breaks the hug and takes her "love" key chain out her purse -- hands it to Carrie. LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your keys. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- don't forget your "love." LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I found my love. I'm leaving that with you. Carrie smiles. Louise starts out the door, turns back. LOUISE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you at my wedding. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you in St. Louis. Louise gives one last look, and leaves. Carrie closes the door. Looks down at "love" in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is sitting at her desk... typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, there were no more distractions. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as I moved on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha walks past Lovro and Magda sitting on chairs out front, sipping ice tea, and up to Miranda's lower east si apartment stoop with the dog on the leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Samantha moved in. The HOT TATTOOED LATIN GUY is still sitting on the stoop front with the ferocious looking pitbull. She starts up t stairs. He checks her out. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm your new neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha. They smile. There is a connection. Samantha looks down. T dog is humping the pitbull. Diego nods approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very, very pregnant Charlotte carrying shopping bags is being seated at a banquette by the HOSTESS (26).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you due?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched; embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank-you. The Hostess walks away as Charlotte settles in and looks around. Her eyes WIDEN. Big is sitting across the room at table -- alone. He hasn't seen her. Charlotte starts to p as the WAITRESS (20's) comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, can I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry -- I can't stay -- Help me -- pull out the table. I can't -- Charlotte pulls herself up off the banquette. As she trie slide out, her belly and shopping bags knock things off t table. Crash. DINERS looks. Big spots her -- their eyes m She moves away as quickly as she can through the room. He gets up and follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte exits the restaurant -- visibly upset. Big is quickly on her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte. Charlotte wait -- He catches up to her - and gently steps to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pregnant -- don't run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see you. She starts crying and talking though the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so mad at you. I was always on your side and then you did that to Carrie -- No, no -- I'm not going to cry -- I'm not going to waste tears on you -- (strong; stomping foot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I curse the day you were born! Charlotte's eyes widen. She stops moving, entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my water just broke. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God -- Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My car's right there. Get in my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to get in your car -- I hate your car. Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte -- we need to get you to the hospital -- Please get in my car. It's right here and ready. Charlotte finally nods. Big hurries her to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie hurries down a corridor -- looking for a room. She spots it, knocks and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. Harry stands there. Beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Congratulations... A girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my lot in life to be surrounded by beautiful women. She kisses him and walks over to the bed where Charlotte holding ROSE, a beautiful baby with thick dark hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. She's gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Rose. Carrie kisses Charlotte on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a beautiful name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Harry's "Bubbie." HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we got a Lily and a Rose. Carrie sits on the edge of the bed. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have to say you two are very cool customers -- just making the "baby's here" call without all the "I'm in labor" drama. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- there was plenty of drama. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My water broke in front of a restaurant. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very dramatic. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- she's not done. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It broke while I was talking to Big. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. Drama. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bumped into him and I got so upset I started crying and then - my water broke. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brought her to the hospital. Stayed until the baby was born. CHARLOTTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was hoping to see you. Silence. Carrie is having a hard time with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- today is not about him. It's about beautiful baby Rose. (beat; forced up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- we know she has Charlotte's hair -- what else do we know? Harry and Charlotte give each other a sad glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks out of Charlotte's room with Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a doll. Mazel tov! She kisses Harry on the cheek and starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to ask you to call him. Carrie stops. Turns around. Looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! It's none of my business. But I felt bad for the poor schmuck hanging around the hospital waiting room hoping to see you. I swear every time he heard someone in heels coming down the hall -- his heart stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry -- it's so much more complicated than you can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it is -- and you have every right to never call him -- but I'm just a big pile of love today --and I feel bad for the guy. He said he's been writing you -- but you never responded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never written me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he wrote because he didn't have your phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's never written me. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, why would he say that he had? Carrie looks at Harry. Lost. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters her apartment. She glances over at her book -- Remembers. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie opens the bookcase drawer and takes o Manila envelope marked: P.O. Box. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie dumps the contents of the envelopes o the desk. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie quickly sorts through the mail -- loo -- looking for something. A letter -- something. Nothing him. She leans back in her chair -- more confused. Her ey drift up to her computer. She wonders if -- JUMP CUT TO: Carrie is logging onto CarrieBradshaw.com. S types in PASSWORD. JUMP CUT TO: CarrieBradshaw.com's "welcome page." She cli on EMAIL. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie scans through emails -- none are from Big. Frustrated she logs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is still at her desk, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours, two manila envelopes and countless emails later, I was just about to give up on the Big riddle when -- She looks back at her computer screen and notices: "CB-assistant." Carrie sits up. Clicks on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had told Louise to put Big in a place where I would never have to hear from him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She types in her password. Nothing. Picks up her phone. D a number. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Louise -- it's me. What's the password to get into your assistant file? Call me. She hangs up and places the phone on a pile of mail -- wh causes the mail to fall over onto the floor. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Carrie reaches down to pick-up the mail -- she notices th "LOVE" key chain has fallen as well. She picks it up and looks at it, has a hunch. CARRIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. JUMP CUT TO: Carrie types the password: "L-O-V-E." Yes! T file opens -- her eyes widen. There on the screen are man many, many emails -- all from JJP@JJP.com. CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as I typed in "love" -- there he was. She clicks on the first e-mail. It opens: It's the love letter from Beethoven, retyped. CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because Big still didn't have the words... he retyped a love letter from Beethoven. JUMP CUT TO: New Email: A love letter from Lord Byron. CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lord Byron. JUMP CUT TO: New Email: A love letter from James Joyce. CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And James Joyce. JUMP CUT TO: New Email: A Love letter from Voltaire. CARRIE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Voltaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT TO: Carrie sits in the chair. Breathless. Overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they were. "The Love Letters of Great Men - Volume One." Plus one more... Written by John James Preston. New email -- It reads: "I know I screwed it up -- but I w love you forever." Carrie impulsively picks up the phone -- starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to call him - but our love... Carrie and Big: volumes one, two, and three... stopped me. She puts the phone down and is about to "delete" the e ma suddenly; the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Louise, standing in a wedding gown. Her MOT (45), GRANDMOTHER (65), and SISTERS (20 15, 8) sit watchi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are shopping for my wedding gown. ANGELA, her youngest sister calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one makes you look weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma -- can you please -- This is a work call. The Mother motions for Angela to sit down. She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay I figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was going to call you anyway -- today is the final day on the Fifth Avenue apartment. You have till six before they change the locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you NOT want those never- worn shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- I completely forgot about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause if you don't -- send them on to me. I'll squeeze my feet into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already five o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? There are never been worn four hundred dollar shoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five twenty-five. (beat; hears herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Carrie drops the phone and jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie runs down the stairs... she spots a passing CAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi! It SCREECHES to a halt. She runs to the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie steps into the elevator. She presses "PH," steps b The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Key in the lock -- Carrie enters. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light in our pre-war apartment looked completely different post- war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks into the bedroom and over to the closet. She pushes open the other double door... Revealing -- Mr. Big - standing there holding the Manolos in his hands looks up -- surprised by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to get these to you. I didn't want it to be a total loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't logic -- it was love. She walks into the closet and over to him. She throws her arms around him. He drops the shoes. They kiss. It's passionate. Very -- very passionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Big are nestled up next to each other on the carpeted floor of the empty walk-in closet. His suit jack is off. Her shoes are off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we ever decide to get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we were afraid it meant something if we didn't. She looks at him and nods. It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to have done that to you. Silence. She touches his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to have done that to you... (beat) And you know the funny part? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a funny part? CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were perfectly happy before we decided to live happily ever after. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. The jokes on us. She nods... she looks around. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good closet. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortable. Is this what you had in mind when you installed the carpet? BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to think I was that smooth. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get up before the new owner bust in on us. They start to get up. Carrie rises first. He starts to ge up, first -- sitting on his side... BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the way we decided to get married -- All business... No romance. That's not the way you propose to someone. He moves further up -- onto one knee -- where he stops. BIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is. She looks down at him -- Is this happening? He holds out hand. She places her hand in his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie Bradshaw -- love of my life - - will you marry me? It is everything Carrie Bradshaw had convinced herself wo never happen. Could never happen. And here it is. She nods. Speechless. Overcome. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, this is why there's a diamond. You need to do something to close the deal. She laughs. He notices her never-worn Manolo on the floor picks it up. Holds it out to her. She lifts her foot and places it in the shoe. Cinderella style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands with Big in front of a JUDGE. She is wearin the simple white suit and her never-worn Manolos from the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the end... Carrie Bradshaw married John James Preston in a label-less dress. Big Smiles. She smiles. Both calm. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the power vested in me, by the state of New York, I now pronounce you husband and wife. You may kiss the bride. Big and Carrie kiss. Then, he whispers into her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever thine. Ever mine. Ever ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Big walk through the courthouse lobby toward t front door holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay that it was just us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. You and me -- like I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still. Would have been nice if you had the girls here. He holds the door open for her as they walk outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Big walk out of the courthouse into the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why I called them. Carrie looks. Miranda, Charlotte, and a MORE SLENDER Sama are standing there. They SCREAM and throw rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazel tov! As the rice hits... Carrie screams and Big laughs. A GUAR hurries over to them. Carrie is spitting out rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- excuse me! You're not allowed to throw rice anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, get over it -- It's New York! She winks at the guard. He shrugs and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big, Carrie, Miranda, Steve, Brady, Charlotte, Harry, Lil rose, Stanford, Samantha are casually gathered around a couple of tables that have been pushed together. A WAITRE comes over balancing hot plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who had the ham and eggs? Big raises his arm. The waitress hands the plate down... Carrie intercepts it and places it in front of Big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a fancy designer reception either. Just food and friends. The Waitress hands out the other breakfasts. People LAUGH Samantha feeds bacon to the dog -- who is wearing a tiny bridal veil on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's books are displayed on a BOOK KIOSK. Carrie stan in front of it READING to a crowd from the galleys of her book. She is wearing READING GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some labels are best left in the closet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling. Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte and Samantha -- back her fighting weight -- walk down the busy street dressed a night on the town. They laugh as they go -- their desig purses swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe when we put a label on people... bride, groom, husband, wife, fat, thin, married, single... we forget to look past the label and see the person. They arrive at the club entrance. A line of PEOPLE wait t let inside. The DOORMAN (30's) spots Carrie, lifts the re rope and lets the girls in -- closing it after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four girls sit at a table drinking "Cosmopolitans."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. This is delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we ever stop drinking these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because everyone else started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sips; then) Well, that is an oldie but goodie. CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And speaking of an oldie but goodie... A WAITER brings birthday cake to the table. The number: " stands proud and tall among the glowing candles. He place down in front of a proud Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- wait -- a toast. The girls lift their glasses to Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Samantha... fifty and fabulous! Samantha smiles, touched -- then blows out her candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To us... and the next fifty! Miranda, Charlotte and Samantha raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the next fifty. They sip and look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there, in the same city where they met as girls, four New York women entered the next phase of their lives... dressed head to toe in love. Samantha licks some icing. Charlotte cuts the cake. Miran helps. Carrie smiles and sips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the one label -- that never goes out of style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside we catch just a glimpse of Carrie and the gi at their table inside the busy club. The CAMERA starts to move away -- passing the line of PEOPLE waiting to get in At the front of the line four TWENTY-SOMETHING WOMEN stan waiting for the red rope to be lifted. As the CAMERA move past them and UP -- the Doorman lifts the red rope and th twenty-something women SQUEAL with excitement and anticipation as they hurry inside. The CAMERA continues U and UP and over the busy and exciting city.
